aelvareth_veilmark-u: A ceremonial Veilmark, sacred to the Ael’Vareth tradition
ai_record-u: or an AI-generated record of your early identity—real or fictional
amnesia-dec: The investigator has no memory of events that have taken place since they were last in a place of safety.
amnesia-dec2: The investigator comes to their senses in some unfamiliar place with no memory of who they are. Their memories will slowly return to them over time.
ancestral_veilmark-u: An ancestral Veilmark recognized by those versed in Lyranni history
animalhandling_desc-u: TODO: add description for animal handling
background_aelvareth_devotee-u: You were raised in the ceremonial houses of Ael’Vareth — homes of ritual, silence, and sacred continuity. Your early life was shaped by ink-sealed truths and generations of coded reverence.
background_aelvareth_devotee_quote-u: “The path is not easy. But it leads home.” — Scribe-Keeper Saelien
background_ash_war_refugee-u: You came from a place that doesn’t exist anymore. A war zone, collapsed sector, or buried city. You lost things early — family, home, maybe even your name—but you clawed forward anyway. Now you carry that weight like armor, and you never stop moving.
background_ash_war_refugee_quote-u: “Some things can’t be fixed. But they can be outrun.” — Nara Dell, trauma medic
background_break_faced_radical-u: You were raised among the Unmasked — a faction that believes hiding is just another kind of prison. You’ve lived openly before, and you’ve seen the cost. But you’d rather face hatred than erase yourself. Your voice is loud, your mask is thin, and your fire runs deep.
background_break_faced_radical_quote-u: “You say I’m dangerous because I want to be seen. I say you’re dangerous because you don’t.” — Myre, Voice of the Fifth Unmasking
background_clawbound_kin_warder-u: You were trained early to protect what mattered — pack, den, territory. Whether in the Wilds or a hidden creche under New Arcadia's mid-tiers, you stood between your own and danger, claws out, instincts sharp. Now, you carry that discipline with you, even if the pack is gone.
background_clawbound_kin_warder_quote-u: “A promise isn’t words. It’s the scar you carry when they don’t come back.” — Mak Vesh, bodyguard to the Emberveil Archive run
background_cliffborn_laborer-u: You weren’t trained in combat. You were trained in balance, in leverage, in shaping weight into permanence. Whether as a builder, hauler, or structural code-welder, your youth was spent beneath scaffolds or atop sun-baked ridgelines.
background_cliffborn_laborer_quote-u: “The world doesn’t care what you break. It remembers what you build.” —Kael Thorne, Archival Mason of Skyreach
background_code_seer_prodigy-u: You weren’t taught by teachers. You were trained by protocols—fed code like food, stories like systems, and magic like firmware. Whether raised by an AI cult or under the blinking gaze of an abandoned cyber-shrine, your world has always been written in loops, glyphs, and gradients of belief.
background_code_seer_prodigy_quote-u: “The difference between a spell and a script is syntax.” —Meiko “Mirrordust” Shin, Arcanet Devourer
background_contract_born-u: You were born under signature and seal—whether by pact, blood, or mercenary code. Loyalty wasn’t given. It was negotiated. You learned early that promises are power, and names carry weight when backed by steel or silence. Reputation? You protect it like a second spine.
background_contract_born_quote-u: “Paper burns. A deal doesn’t. Remember that.” —Raiku the Gray, Pactbreaker and Broker
background_corpsepath_reclaimer-u: Necrotech isn’t about reverence. It’s about resource. You were trained to see death as architecture—to rebuild it, animate it, and strip it for parts. Whether you worked in a death clinic, a black-market reprocessing node, or a Huskspire forge, you learned how to make use of what others fear.
background_corpsepath_reclaimer_quote-u: “Most people see a body and flinch. You saw leverage.” —Dran Kett, Boneframe Architect
background_cross_signal_raised-u:
You didn’t grow up in a warren. You didn’t learn Chirr at the right frequency. Maybe your parents were wanderers, or maybe you were pulled from the wreckage of some broken transit pod and raised by humans, Feran, or Khadra. You learned early that speech doesn’t always mean what it says—that tone, rhythm, and metaphor are often the true payload.
You didn’t abandon your Scav instincts. You just added translation layers. And now you know how to work in a world where nothing means just one thing.
background_cross_signal_raised_quote-u: “They didn’t explain what they meant. They expected me to feel it. So, I learned to fake the feeling—and then I learned to understand it.” —Patchlock Jyn, alias translator and empathic debugger
background_data_hatched-u: You weren’t born in any traditional sense. Whether from a surrogate vat, a legacy AI caretaking cluster, or a sealed knowledge enclave, your early life was filtered through data, structured routines, and synthesized learning. You think in maps, modules, and risk equations—rarely in trust.
background_data_hatched_quote-u: “Born from bandwidth. Raised by protocols.” — Syn9, registered dentity cluster
background_dust_seer_novice-u: You were raised in one of the ancient desert enclaves—where the winds whisper the names of the dead and diviners trace futures in ash and sand. Whether you walked the outer dunes or tended relic-shrines, the Veil was never far from you.
background_dust_seer_novice_quote-u: “The wind may bury names—but not all voices fade.” —Kaeli Sunshale, Veilwarden of the Last Outpost
background_echoborne-u: Descended from a bloodline of Veilwalkers, court mystics, or archivists, your presence carries weight. Whether earned or inherited, you are a reminder of power long woven into lineage.
background_echoborne_quote-u: “You hear echoes of greatness. The question is—will you rise to match them?” — High Scribe Relan, House Archivist
background_enclave_born-u: You were raised behind walls — not always golden, but high enough to keep the world out. Whether it was a corporate childcare ward, an academic arcology, or the glass corridors of a firstborn citizen tier, you learned the value of reputation, compliance, and how to ask for what you want with a smile sharp enough to draw blood.
background_enclave_born_quote-u: “Clean air, clean hands, clean lies.” — Riss Vonn, former Corezone candidate
background_forgeblood_scavenger-u: You grew up among ruin-seekers and junk-scribes — those who see beauty in rust and stories in salvage. You learned the sacred art of patchwork survival, and that even broken things can be sacred.
background_forgeblood_scavenger_quote-u: “Nothing is trash until it’s dead. And even then, ask twice.” — Drex Tullar, Tinker-Mystic
background_ghostline_runner-u: Your first name was sold. Your second was stolen. You grew up embedded in the fringe economy — courier, slicer, infiltrator — trading secrets and masks as currency. You learned to trust code more than people, and vanish when the wrong one came looking.
background_ghostline_runner_quote-u: “Information is just another identity. And I wear both well.” — Alias: ‘Glass’, Contract Broker
background_ghostline_whelp-u: Born in the back lanes of fractured arcologies and the glow of data temples, you grew up between veilshocks and grid storms. You learned to hear both spirit and signal in the quiet—slipping between echoes, ducking ICE traces, reading the weight of silence like a second language.
background_ghostline_whelp_quote-u: “Spirits talk. Firewalls hum. I just listen better than most.” —Zero-Tail, Freelance Veilcaster
background_glide_spire_scion-u: Raised in a cliffside arcology, you moved effortlessly between etiquette and survival. You learned to slip through conversation like a dancer — poised, precise, and prepared for the unexpected
background_glide_spire_scion_quote-u: “Don’t let the silk fool you. I know which fork goes where — and which wrist to cut.” —Elara Kade, Cultural Icon
background_gutterfire_youth-u: You didn’t climb the ladder — you slipped between the rungs. Raised on the fringe or beneath the mid-tier plates, you survived by instinct, bluff, and running fast when things went loud. You learned which lights meant danger, and which shadows meant home.
background_gutterfire_youth_quote-u: “They called it crime. I called it breakfast.”— Avi Jex, slicer-for-hire
background_hatchwarren_drifter-u: You grew up in the crawlspaces between sectors—half-formed infrastructure, half-abandoned dreams. You learned to sleep near heat vents, track signal drops, and scavenge before anyone else even knew the cache existed. You know the sound of a breaker going soft before it burns out. You move like static and strike like a glitch no one patched.
background_hatchwarren_drifter_quote-u: “Doesn’t matter if it’s locked. That just means it still works.” —Tavik-7, Crawlway Echo
background_horn_carved_wanderer-u: You were born beneath endless sky and shifting moons, part of a clan that never settled. Every hill had a name. Every step was history. You learned to track storms, read the stars, and listen for the pulse of the land.
background_horn_carved_wanderer_quote-u: “Our map is memory. Our compass is the wind.” —Jaya Senn, Pathkeeper of Clan Varn
background_legacy_bearer-u: You were chosen to inherit a legacy mask — an identity worn by one who came before. You studied their voice, their movements, their stories. You don’t just wear their face. You carry their memory, and the weight of what it meant to be them
background_legacy_bearer_quote-u: “This face is older than I am. I carry it for someone who can’t anymore.” — Toval Arin, Echo-Caller of Greyhold
background_loop_minder_initiate-u: You were raised inside a Freehand data warren—more server cluster than shelter. You spent your youth tracing signal decay, mapping ghost-pings, and slicing locked nodes with makeshift code. You learned to read people the way you read systems: by where they break first.
background_loop_minder_initiate_quote-u: “The system always leaves a backdoor. You just need to think like it forgot.” —Rinza, Pulseflow Slicer
background_oathbreakers_kin-u: Your family bears a mark—betrayal, failure, exile. You weren’t born into glory, but into expectation: to fix what came before. You learned to fight harder, speak less, and carry your shame without complaint. Redemption isn’t given. It’s carved out.
background_oathbreakers_kin_quote-u: “A name can be redeemed. But only if it’s carried like a blade.” —Thava Rimehand, Blacklist Sentinel
background_outpost_raised-u: You were born far from the towers — in a frontier hold, dustfarm, or fringe commune where the only thing colder than the nights was the silence between screams. You learned to shoot before you learned to barter, and to fix things before asking for help.
background_outpost_raised_quote-u: “Sand. Silence. A shotgun and a solar still. That’s childhood.” — Mika Alren, circuit-runner of the Dustline
background_packborn_drifter-u: You were raised in a roaming pack — scavenging, migrating, watching the land change underfoot. Your world was one of hushed voices, quiet fires, and bond-rituals etched into memory. You learned how to listen first, act second, and vanish third.
background_packborn_drifter_quote-u: “They raised me to run — and to know when to stop.” — Shesska Vell, wayfinder of the Low Fracture routes
background_run_shadow_cub-u: You were raised on the move—between rooftops and dead forests, ledges and lightning rails. Yours was a life of silence, sprint, and edge-balancing. The road made you clever. The wind made you quiet. And you never stayed long enough for your footprints to harden.
background_run_shadow_cub_quote-u: “No tail trails the wind. No eye follows the blur.” —Yuna Driftstep, Scout of the Thirteenth Coil
background_scavsteel_whelp-u: You were born in the shadow of scrap towers and arc-flicker salvage yards, where every broken panel might spark a miracle. Your hands knew rust before soap, and your first tools were stolen, gifted, or bartered in desperation. You see potential in ruin — and utility in everything else.
background_scavsteel_whelp_quote-u: “Hard part isn’t finding the parts. It’s remembering why you needed them in the first place.” — Pryce ‘Wirejaw’ Kethel, deckrunner of Tier 9
background_scorchborn_fugitive-u: You weren’t just shaped by fire. You ran from it. Your past is a blur of betrayal, smoke, and blood. Maybe your pack was wiped out. Maybe you were exiled. All you know is that you survived — and now you don’t trust anyone until they’ve earned the right to bleed beside you.
background_scorchborn_fugitive_quote-u: “They burned the den. I burned the path behind me.” — Raka Thornjaw, rogue Veil scout
background_shatterlink_courier-u: You carried messages others couldn’t. Through active scan zones, through arcanotech static fields, through Corp zones on full lockdown. Whether by rooftop crawl, hidden liftshaft, or data-shadow encoded into your spinejack, you moved information no one else could touch. You don’t just know the map—you know beneath it.
background_shatterlink_courier_quote-u: “Didn’t ask who it was for. Just asked where the drop went.” —“Ghosthand” Vesh, independent signal runner
background_shrine_den_scion-u: You were raised beneath carved beams and paper wards, where spirit-whispers slipped between incense and stillness. Whether your clan upheld a sacred pact or simply honored the memory of the old rites, you grew up on the threshold between the Veil and the waking world—feet bare on stone, heart tuned to the pulse of what hides behind the wind.
background_shrine_den_scion_quote-u: “Some of us were born in silence. The rest of you never learned to hear it.” —Kana Riyo, Night-Seer of the Third Flame
background_soft_year_drifter-u: You grew up on the edge of cities, in shelters and stolen places, trying on forms like borrowed jackets. You learned early how the world looks at you differently depending on what you wear—and how to use that. You became a chameleon not by choice, but by necessity.
background_soft_year_drifter_quote-u: “I became a dozen people before I ever figured out which one was mine.” — Kala Verrin, Maskwright Apprentice
background_spiritbound_techshaper-u: Born to walk two worlds — metal and memory — you were marked by innovation and instinct. While others feared your gifts, your clan gave you tools instead of chains. You speak to circuits and spirits alike.
background_spiritbound_techshaper_quote-: “If a spirit wants a body, I’ll build one. If it wants freedom...that’s harder.” —Neshri, RAM-Binder
background_stonehold_disciple-u: You were raised in the quiet halls of a traditional clan bastion, where each stone bore a name and every sunrise began with stillness. Your life was one of rituals, sparring drills, and the steady hum of ward-chants echoing through reinforced corridors.
background_stonehold_disciple_quote-u: “A shield is only heavy if you doubt its purpose.” —Irran Vel-Korr, Warden of the Tern Spire
background_tradition_keeper-u: You were shaped by sacred rhythms — ritual, memory, and reverence. Others forgot the old oaths. Your clan did not. You carry the lore of spirits and soil not as superstition, but as survival
background_tradition_keeper_quote-u: “The land sings in quiet voices. If you can’t hear them, you’ve strayed too far.” — Elder Myrren
background_urban_stalkkit-u: You grew up between scaffold struts, broken monorails, and the skeletal upper ruins of arcoblocks. Your playground was a rusted skyline. You learned to read terrain like a language — and how to make exits no one else could follow.
background_urban_stalkkit_quote-u: “They called it trespassing. I called it knowing where you weren’t looking.” — Venn, rooftop courier and rooftop thief
background_urban_tread-u: Your clan adapted to steel and signal. Raised in the city’s hidden layers, you learned to survive through speed, instinct, and the rhythm of boots on broken concrete. You read alleys like others read maps
background_urban_tread_quote-u: “The Wilds are honest. Cities lie with neon smiles.” — ‘Grin,’ rooftop runner
background_veil_hunters_cub-u: You were raised on the edges — where the Veil breathes and the city recoils. Your early life was spent tracking things that didn’t leave footprints, hunting through haunted concrete, and returning with proof you couldn’t always explain. You learned how to strike first and think later.
background_veil_hunters_cub_quote-u: “The claws aren’t for show. Neither is the silence.” — Sareth Hal, Vergehowl pack-rider
background_veilhaven_attendant-u: Raised inside a Veilhaven, you were surrounded by faces both new and ancestral. You were taught the old ways, the sacred trust of names, and the quiet rituals that keep your people safe. You’ve seen what lies behind the masks—and why they matter.
background_veilhaven_attendant_quote-u: “We were never alone, not really. Just waiting for the right door to open.” — Sirel Nov, Haven-Ward of Level 12
background_wardens_apprentice-u: You were trained for service: a watchtower observer, guard in a sacred enclave, or escort to emissaries across dangerous ground. You learned the value of silence, observation, and standing still while others flinched.
background_wardens_apprentice_quote-u: “Judgment is the weight you carry after the blade is put away.” —Ruhm Dask, Nightwatch Captain
background_whisper_walker-u: You were raised in the outer enclaves of Lyranni society, where silence is sacred and the Veil hums beneath every breath. You learned to listen to what others couldn’t—and follow paths no one else could see.
background_whisper_walker_quote-u: “Some walk roads. Others follow echoes.” — Sister Aveline, Zureth’Kai Diviner
background_zurethkai_flameborn-u: Born of rebellion, you grew up around rogue tech-shamans, ArcNet engineers, or Veil-disrupting visionaries. You were taught to question sacred texts—and rewrite them in code or flame.
background_zurethkai_flameborn_quote-u: “Tradition is just peer pressure from the dead.” — Auralys Venth, Flameborn Artisan
battered-dec: The investigator comes to their senses (1D10) hours later to find themselves battered and bruised. Hit points are reduced to half of what they were before going insane, though this does not cause a Major wound. They have not been robbed. How the damage was sustained is up to the Keeper.
blade_or_relic_salvaged-u: A blade or relic salvaged from your escape — scarred, worn, and always within reach
bonded_courier_node-u: A bonded courier node or arc-coded fragment sealed beneath your skin or in your tail-wrapping.
bone_tagged_surgical_injector-u: A bone-tagged surgical injector or necro-welded prosthetic salvaged from your first successful reanimation.
burner_id_package-u: A burner ID package — encrypted credentials, a biometric scrambler, and a known safehouse
career_arcane_gunslinger_anchor_shot_rul: Type: Action (Attack; Anti-Veil/Brand) • Cost: 1d4+1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Make a firearm attack with your Bound Focus. On hit, until the end of your next turn the target cannot teleport, phase, or become invisible by any means. Veil-native targets must also pass POW with 1 penalty die or, for that duration, cannot move or change range bands.
career_arcane_gunslinger_arcane_cartridg: Type: Free Action (Infuse) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: This attack only — Your Focus shot deals arcane damage and +1 damage. Does not stack with other Infuse effects. Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_blackout_salvo_: Type: Maneuver (Infuse: Anti-Tech+) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — On hit, plus damage, emit a Short-radius shutdown pulse: unattended devices & drones off 1 round; attended-gear users must pass POW with 1 penalty die or lose Reactions and take –20% to all attacks until end of next turn (on success, still –10%). Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_bound_reload_ru: Type: Free Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — If you used any Infuse talent this round, reload your Focus as a Free Action instead of a Maneuver.
career_arcane_gunslinger_break_contact_r: Type: Reaction (Mobility/Guard) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you hit with your Bound Focus or when an enemy misses you with a melee attack, immediately Disengage and move one range band without triggering reactions. If you were not Engaged, instead gain Light Cover until the start of your next turn. This movement does not grant additional Actions or Reactions.
career_arcane_gunslinger_chain_shot_rule: Type: Free Action (Follow-Up) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After you hit with an Infused attack using your Bound Focus, make one additional firearm attack with your Bound Focus at –10% against a different target within Short range of the original target. The follow-up attack deals arcane damage and may impale. The follow-up cannot receive any Infuse or Geometry effects, does not grant additional Reactions, and cannot trigger further follow-up attacks.
career_arcane_gunslinger_close_orbit_rul: Type: Maneuver (stance; ends end of your turn) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — When firing Handgun/SMG at Engaged range with your Focus, reduce close-quarters penalty by one step.
career_arcane_gunslinger_corner_cut_rule: Type: Free Action (Geometry) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: This attack only — Ignore Partial Cover for this Focus attack (no accuracy penalty). Cannot bypass Full Cover. Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_deadmark_beacon: Type: Action (Attack; Brand+) • Cost: 1d4+1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Make a firearm attack with your Bound Focus. On hit, until the end of the current round: allies gain +1 bonus die on attacks against the target and ignore Partial Cover when doing so; the target suffers 1 penalty die on Dodge rolls.
career_arcane_gunslinger_disruptive_roun: Type: Maneuver (Infuse: Suppression) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: This attack only — On hit, the target loses Reactions and takes –10% to all attacks until the end of its next turn. If the target is a drone, turret, vehicle, or wearing a powered exosuit, it also suffers 1 penalty die on its next attack or Piloting/operation roll before the end of its next turn. Damage resolves normally. Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_flicker_ward_ru: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare before the attacker’s roll to impose 1 penalty die on an incoming ranged or spell attack. If the attack misses, regain 1 Strain (once per Scene).
career_arcane_gunslinger_overcharged_car: Type: Maneuver (Infuse+) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: This attack only — This shot becomes arcane, gains +1 damage, and on a Hard+ hit treats the attack as AP 2 (stacks with Mark’s AP). Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_phase_pin_rules: Type: Maneuver (Brand/Anti-Veil) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: Mark ends when you attack or at Scene end — Mark a visible target within Medium range. Your next Infused hit against that target this Scene applies the following effect: Veil-native targets must pass POW with 1 penalty die or, on their next turn, cannot move, teleport, or phase by any means. Non-Veil targets instead suffer –10% to all movement-based actions until the start of their next turn.
career_arcane_gunslinger_rangefold_nudge: Type: Free Action (Geometry) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: This attack only — Treat the target as one range band closer for penalties (cannot enable out-of-range shots). Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_rangefold_step_: Type: Free Action (Geometry/Mobility) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Shift one range band; if not Engaged, this move does not trigger reactions. Cannot be used while Engaged.
career_arcane_gunslinger_severing_round_: Type: Action (Attack; Infuse: Anti-Ward+) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Make a firearm attack with your Bound Focus. On hit, the attack deals arcane damage and for this attack only, the target’s physical and arcane DR are treated as 0. After damage resolves, the target must pass POW with 1 penalty die; on a failure, it is Staggered (loses Reactions and suffers –20% to attacks) until the end of its next turn. This effect does not bypass immunities or effects that prevent damage entirely.
career_arcane_gunslinger_short_fold_rule: Type: Maneuver (Geometry — turn-long) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene; lasts to end of your turn — Until turn end, Focus shots treat targets as one band closer and ignore 1 penalty die from light obstructions (smoke, shimmer, glare). Requires Bound Focus.
career_arcane_gunslinger_spell_conduit_r: Type: Action (Attack; Conduit) • Cost: 1d6 Strain + spell’s Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Make a firearm attack with your Bound Focus and resolve its damage first. If the attack hits, immediately resolve one known single-target spell against the same target as part of the same Action. The spell is cast normally but the target suffers 1 penalty die on its resistance roll (2 penalty dice if the firearm attack achieved a Hard Success or better). This sequence counts as one attack action, does not grant additional Reactions, and cannot be combined with other capstone effects.
career_arcane_gunslinger_spellmark_rules: Type: Maneuver (Brand) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: Expires at the start of your next turn — Tag one visible target within Medium range. Your next attack against that target before the Mark expires gains +10%. If that attack also uses Arcane Cartridge, it gains AP 1 for that attack only. The Mark ends immediately after the attack resolves.
career_arcane_gunslinger_ward_piercing_r: Type: Maneuver (Infuse: Anti-Ward) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: This attack only — On hit, for this attack only, reduce the target’s arcane DR or ward DR by 2 (minimum 0). In addition, the target cannot gain new magical shielding until the start of your next turn. Requires Bound Focus.
career_codeweaver_arc_sigil_link_rules-u: Type: Passive (Skill Substitution) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When interacting with Arcanotech systems, you may roll Magic (Technomancy) instead of Electronics or Computer Use. Does not apply to physical repairs or mechanical breakdowns.
career_codeweaver_arc_thread_override_ru: Type: Reaction (Spell) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A hostile device or automated system within Medium activates. Effect: Immediately cast a Technomancy spell you know with a casting time of 1 Action or less that targets technology. The spell resolves normally and cannot benefit from other cost-reduction talents. This talent may affect Hardened systems only if the chosen spell explicitly allows it.
career_codeweaver_backdoor_ritual_rules-: Type: Maneuver (Anchor) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you successfully establish access to a network, you embed a temporary backdoor during that intrusion. Once during that same intrusion, you may designate one system interaction you perform as priority execution. That interaction resolves immediately and does not require time to complete. The interaction must be a live authorization effect such as toggling or redirecting sensors, opening or closing a door or access point, suppressing or downgrading an alarm for 1 round, or issuing a simple command to a non-Hardened endpoint you already control. This does not apply to data extraction, Deep Scans, or latent intrusions, does not prevent escalation or System Overrun, and ends immediately when the intrusion ends. Only one Backdoor may be active at a time. Backdoors cannot be embedded into Hardened systems unless the initial access explicitly allowed Hardened interaction.
career_codeweaver_cascade_override_rules: Type: Special immediate (Chain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you successfully disable or control a device, immediately target a second device within Short; the second target resists with 1 penalty die.
career_codeweaver_clean_loop_feedback_ru: Type: Free Action (Stabilize) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully cast a Technomancy spell that targets or interfaces with a device, drone, or Arcanotech system, reduce the next instance of Strain you suffer this scene from a tech-based backlash, resistance effect, or Arcanotech malfunction by 1 (minimum 0). This does not reduce Strain from System Overrun, does not reduce the Strain cost of the triggering spell, and does not restore spent Strain.
career_codeweaver_code_injection_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Payload) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully establish access to a network, or after you successfully affect an endpoint system with a contested slice or Technomancy spell, you may immediately compress one system interaction during that intrusion. Choose one live authorization action you perform during this intrusion (such as redirecting cameras, suppressing alarms, or manipulating access controls); that action requires one fewer round to complete (minimum 0). This does not reduce the time required for data extraction, Deep Scans, or latent intrusions, and does not delay escalation or System Overrun.
career_codeweaver_command_injection_rule: Type: Free Action (Multicommand) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you cast a Technomancy spell on, or issue a command to, a device or drone you control, you may issue two distinct commands instead of one. These commands resolve normally and do not reduce the time required for objectives, sustained effects, or latent intrusions.
career_codeweaver_crash_field_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Field) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Create a Medium-radius crash zone for 1 round. Affected drones and Arcanotech systems must pass a POW or INT test or suffer 2 penalty dice on all Actions until the start of your next turn; on a Fumble, the system is disabled for that round only. This effect does not apply to system failsafe checks, resistance rolls, or upkeep tests unless explicitly stated. This effect applies to Hardened systems.
career_codeweaver_hardlight_override_rul: Type: Maneuver (Override) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Project a hardlight sigil into a simple, unattended device within Short (door, turret, basic drone, unsecured node). Roll Magic (Technomancy) or Slicing (your choice). On a success, trigger one basic function (open, shut down, disengage). Does not bypass secure, encrypted, or complex systems, or systems under direct control of another slicer or AI; such systems resist using their normal opposed roll, without penalty, or require higher-tier effects. This effect cannot target Hardened systems.

career_codeweaver_null_interference_fiel: Type: Maneuver (Field) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: At-will — Create a Short-radius disruption field centered on you for 1 round. career_codeweaver_protocol_ascendance_ru: Type: Action (Rule Override) • Cost: 1d6 + 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — While you are actively connected, forcibly impose protocol instability on all drones, automated systems, and Arcanotech devices within Medium for the remainder of the scene. career_codeweaver_pulse_hijack_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Control) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Attempt to seize momentary control of a simple automated device within Short (surveillance camera, turret, basic drone). career_codeweaver_reality_patch_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Auto-Cast) • Cost: Double the triggering spell’s Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You fail a defense against a tech-based or Arcanotech effect, or a system within Medium catastrophically malfunctions. career_codeweaver_recursive_pulse_rules-: Type: Reaction (Retry) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You fail a Slicing or Magic (Technomancy) roll to access or affect a device within Short. Effect: Reroll the check with 1 penalty die. On success, resolve normally.
career_codeweaver_scramble_protocol_rule: Type: Maneuver (Debuff) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: At-will — Disrupt one active drone or Arcanotech system within Short for 1 round; it suffers 1 penalty die on all tech-based or automated actions. career_codeweaver_signal_possession_rule: Type: Action (Technomantic Overwrite) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — While you are actively connected to a network or system, you forcibly overwrite the command identity of one drone, turret, or Arcanotech construct within Medium. career_codeweaver_signal_sync_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — On your next Access Roll to establish entry into a network this scene, gain +1 bonus die. career_codeweaver_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_codeweaver_subroutine_leash_rules: Type: Passive (Control) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While you have control of a drone or automated system through any effect (such as a talent, spell, or successful Slicing or Technomancy interaction), you may direct it as an allied NPC on your turn for the duration of that control. career_codeweaver_synthetic_harmony_rule: Type: Free Action (Tempo) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you successfully establish access to a network, or after you successfully affect a device or drone with a contested slice or Technomancy spell, gain +1 bonus die on your next Technomancy spell that targets or interfaces with that same system during this scene.
career_codeweaver_system_sovereignty_pro: Type: Action (Authority Imposition) • Cost: 1d6 + 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — While you are actively connected to a network or system, you assert overriding technomantic priority within a technological space inside Medium. career_codeweaver_veil_reactor_stabilize: Type: Reaction (Catastrophe Guard) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You would suffer Veil Corruption, an Arcanotech malfunction, or take damage from a tech-based or Veil-powered source. career_codeweaver_veil_thread_tap_rules-: Type: Maneuver (Scan) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — You attune briefly to ambient signal bleed and Arcanotech resonance. career_combat_engineer_auto_repair_subro: Type: Action (Mod) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Install a routine on a drone/turret; on Mechanics success it regains 1d3 HP at end of each round. Only one such routine may be active at a time on that unit.
career_combat_engineer_breachfinders_eye: Type: Maneuver (Scan) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Roll Mechanics or Demolitions with +1 bonus die to identify a weak point within Short. Your next attack or sabotage against that point gains +1 bonus die and +1d4 damage or causes a GM-ruled complication.
career_combat_engineer_collapse_engineer: Type: Action (Demolitions) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Rig a prepared structure to collapse on a designated trigger. Requires Demolitions.
career_combat_engineer_compensating_buil: Type: Passive (Tools) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Reduce penalty dice for makeshift tools by one step. • Also: 1/Scene, when using scavenged parts, gain +10% to Mechanics or Electronics.
career_combat_engineer_controlled_breach: Type: Action (Explosive) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Place and detonate a directional charge. Roll Demolitions or Mechanics: on success, deal 1d6 damage and disable/stun the target for 1 round; vs barriers, halve Integrity before damage.
career_combat_engineer_dead_switch_logic: Type: Maneuver (Trap) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After Breachfinder’s Eye, rig a timed collapse/trap that triggers in 1 round or on activation.
career_combat_engineer_fail_safe_trigger: Type: Action (Trap) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Rig a repaired object to explode (1d6 damage) or shut down if tampered with.
career_combat_engineer_failsafe_architec: Type: Reaction (Prevent) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A system you worked on this scene within Short would suffer a major malfunction. Effect: Prevent it (no roll).
career_combat_engineer_failsafe_codex_ru: Type: Reaction (Restore) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Instantly restore a damaged system you’ve interacted with to half HP and immune to malfunctions for the scene.
career_combat_engineer_field_constructor: Type: Action (Deployable) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Rapidly construct one: (1) Turret (2d6 damage, 3 rounds), (2) Barricade (+2 Armor & cover), or (3) Utility drone. Requires Mechanics. Breaks down at scene end.
career_combat_engineer_field_fix_rules-u: Type: Action (Repair) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt Mechanics on a physically accessible device, drone, or structure to restore 1d6 + EDU bonus HP (not above max HP).
career_combat_engineer_fortified_anchor_: Type: Action (Reinforce) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Reinforce a structure/device. On success it gains +4 HP and is immune to forced movement/topple for the scene.
career_combat_engineer_hijack_protocol_r: Type: Action (Seize Control) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt to take full control of an automated drone/device within Medium. Target resists with its Security Level; on Hard Success, you control it for the scene unless interrupted.
career_combat_engineer_master_of_collaps: Type: Action (Networked Triggers) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger all sabotage points you’ve placed in a structure. On success, all collapse zones deal 3d6 damage; targets must Dodge or become trapped.
career_combat_engineer_overclock_protoco: Type: Maneuver (Boost) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Push a repaired system beyond spec. On Mechanics or Electronics success, it gains +10% to its next roll, then suffers 1d4 damage afterward.
career_combat_engineer_patchwork_tools_r: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When making Mechanics or Electronics without proper tools, ignore tool penalties and gain +10% on that roll.
career_combat_engineer_pathfinders_insti: Type: Passive (Navigation) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While Tactile Memory is active, you and allies gain +10% to Navigate/Stealth in that structure and may avoid one environmental hazard there per session.
career_combat_engineer_power_splice_rule: Type: Action (Power) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Divert power from one device to another. On Mechanics success, the target regains 1d6 HP or reactivates for 1 round.
career_combat_engineer_precision_overrid: Type: Passive (Reroll) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When using Quick Bypass, you may reroll the Security Systems check.
career_combat_engineer_quick_bypass_rule: Type: Maneuver (Bypass) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Attempt Security Systems to pick a non-magical lock or disable a non-magical alarm as a Maneuver instead of an Action. Does not affect warded/arcane systems.
career_combat_engineer_rapid_jury_rig_ru: Type: Action (Temporary Fix) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt Mechanics to create a temporary battlefield fix. On success, it functions for the scene (≈10 minutes), then fails safely.
career_combat_engineer_reactive_primer_r: Type: Maneuver (Failsafe) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Attach a primer so a drone/turret reduced to 0 HP stays online at 1 HP for one final Action, then shuts down.
career_combat_engineer_reactive_scaffold: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A nearby device/structure (Short) takes damage. Effect: Attempt Mechanics to reduce damage by 1d6.

career_combat_engineer_right_tool_for_it: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — If using a repair kit/toolkit, gain +1 bonus die on a Mechanics or Electronics roll. Does not stack with Patchwork Tools.
career_combat_engineer_sabotage_relay_ru: Type: Action (Sabotage) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Corrupt a mechanical system so the next user suffers 1d6 damage or a 1-round misfire.
career_combat_engineer_saboteurs_signatu: Type: Passive (Upgrade) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When placing a sabotage effect, add one: +1d6 damage, +10% avoid detection, or +1 round delay.
career_combat_engineer_stat_boost_rules-: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_combat_engineer_structural_collap: Type: Action (Demolitions) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — On Demolitions success, collapse a weakened structure/section: targets in range take 2d6 damage unless they Dodge.
career_combat_engineer_system_subjugatio: Type: Action (Area Seize) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt to seize all devices in a small area: Opposed Electronics vs. Security Level. On Hard Success, control lasts the scene.
career_combat_engineer_tactical_recompil: Type: Action (Override) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Attempt to override a hostile drone within Short. On success, it becomes Neutral for 1 round; on Hard Success, it follows 1 simple command.
career_combat_engineer_tactile_memory_ru: Type: Maneuver (Study) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After physically inspecting a structure/device, for the rest of the scene gain +10% to related Mechanics, Demolitions, or Security Systems and halve action time for those tasks.
career_combat_medic_adrenal_shield_matri: Type: Free Action (Combat Stim) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you successfully restore HP with First Aid or Medicine, grant the target 1d6 temporary HP until the end of the scene. career_combat_medic_emergency_triage_net: Type: Action (Split Heal) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Choose up to two allies within Short. Make Medicine once and divide the HP healed between them (each must receive at least 1 HP).
career_combat_medic_endurance_conditioni: Type: Passive (Resilience) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Gain +2 maximum HP.
career_combat_medic_field_expeditor_rule: Type: Free Action (Accelerate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — On your turn, perform First Aid or Medicine as a Free Action instead of an Action.
career_combat_medic_field_stabilizer_rul: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Before the end of your turn, your next First Aid or Medicine check you make on an unconscious or dying ally gains +1 bonus die.
career_combat_medic_ghost_of_the_er_rule: Type: Free Action (Advance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you take a Move Maneuver toward an injured ally, that Move does not provoke Overwatch or reactions. Until your next turn, attacks targeting you suffer 1 penalty die.
career_combat_medic_golden_hour_doctrine: Type: Free Action (Protocol) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Declare at the start of your first turn in a hostile scene. career_combat_medic_injector_harness_rul: Type: Maneuver (Injector) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Perform a First Aid, stim, or injector-based action as a Maneuver instead of an Action. The item is consumed normally, and all healing limits, daily uses, and Healing Saturation rules still apply.
career_combat_medic_last_measure_injecti: Type: Action (Extreme Intervention) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt Medicine on an unconscious or dying ally within Engaged. career_combat_medic_medical_override_rul: Type: Free Action (Boost) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Before rolling First Aid or Medicine, declare a Medical Override. career_combat_medic_miracle_protocol_rul: Type: Action (Critical Care) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt Medicine on an ally within Engaged. Healing limits apply.
career_combat_medic_no_one_dies_today_ru: Type: Reaction (Last Stand) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: An ally within Medium would be reduced to 0 HP. All consequences resolve afterward unless the target is healed or stabilized.
career_combat_medic_overwatch_healer_rul: Type: Passive (Covering Fire) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Designate one injured ally (≤ half HP) within Short at the start of your turn. If an enemy attacks that ally, you gain +1 bonus die on your next attack against that enemy this scene.
career_combat_medic_pain_doesnt_matter_r: Type: Action (Revive Consciousness) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Attempt a Medicine check on an unconscious ally or an ally who failed a CON check due to a major wound. career_combat_medic_painkiller_protocol_: Type: Passive (Buff) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — After you successfully restore HP to an ally with First Aid or Medicine, that ally gains +1 bonus die on their next action this scene. This bonus may only be applied once per healing instance.
career_combat_medic_pressure_seal_rules-: Type: Action (Stabilize) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt a Medicine check on a bleeding-out ally below 0 HP within Engaged range. career_combat_medic_quickdraw_injector_r: Type: Reaction (Inject) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You or an ally within Engaged would benefit from an injector or stim. career_combat_medic_stay_with_me_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Stabilize) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An ally within Engaged or Short is reduced to 0 HP. career_combat_medic_surgical_clarity_rul: Type: Reaction (Reroll) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you fail a First Aid or Medicine check, you may immediately reroll the check with +1 bonus die. career_combat_medic_tactical_redeploymen: Type: Reaction (Move) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An ally within Medium takes damage. Effect: Move one range band closer toward that ally (normal movement rules apply).
career_combat_medic_trauma_team_reflexes: Type: Free Action (Tactics) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Swap Initiative with a willing ally; both must not have acted yet this round.
career_combat_medic_triage_commander_rul: Type: Free Action (Coordination) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you successfully restore HP to an ally on your turn, choose one other ally within Short. career_combat_medic_veil_immunologist_ru: Type: Action (Cleanse) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Attempt a Medicine check on an ally within Engaged who suffered Veil Corruption this scene. career_combat_medic_vital_scan_overlay_r: Type: Free Action (Scan) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — If the target is below half HP, gain +1 bonus die on a First Aid or Medicine check against them. On a success, you may also identify medical conditions only, such as internal injuries, bleeding, toxins, infections, or trauma-related complications.
career_faceman_all_access_walk_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Compress the scene’s ordinary scrutiny by the same group into one high-stakes test: roll Deception or Persuade once. On success, routine checks by that group treat you and up to two allies as cleared for the rest of the scene, unless a new authority or novel protocol appears (Hard: up to five allies).
career_faceman_chain_of_command_gambit_r: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Name one crew/guild/agency active this scene. For the rest of the current interaction, any non-supervisor member you address treats your procedural instruction as priority unless they succeed a POW roll. Supervisors resist with a bonus die.
career_faceman_claim_authority_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Assert temporary oversight: Persuade vs. POW on a gatekeeper in earshot. Elite units ignore; supervisors resist with a bonus die.
career_faceman_clock_the_rules_rules-u: Type: Maneuver • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Make Insight during a live exchange. On success, learn one operative rule/custom the gatekeeper follows (shift change, clan token, contractor script) and gain a bonus die on your next social roll against that person this scene.
career_faceman_conversational_tyrant_rul: Type: Scene • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — For one scene, the first time you address any professional present, you may choose Deception or Persuade and gain a bonus die on that first-contact roll against each individual.
career_faceman_cover_flip_rules-u: Type: Reaction (before scrutiny) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Swap into a prepared identity. Roll Disguise in place of the demanded social check for that scrutiny. If you Clocked the Rules on this screener earlier this scene, add a bonus die.
career_faceman_deep_cover_switch_rules-u: Type: Maneuver • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — Swap to a prepared identity without consuming your action. The first social roll under that identity this scene gains a bonus die.
career_faceman_default_to_process_rules-: Type: Reaction (before a confrontation escalates) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — When a gatekeeper is about to detain or escalate, roll Persuade vs. POW. career_faceman_follow_my_lead_rules-u: Type: Reaction (after your success; before ally’s roll) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After you succeed on Deception or Persuade with this group, one ally attempting a related check this scene gains a bonus die and may cite your success as precedent.
career_faceman_frame_the_interaction_rul: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — Recast the challenge as your process. career_faceman_host_escort_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Persuade vs. POW a non-supervisor gatekeeper (usher, clerk, quartermaster, crew chief). On success, they personally accompany you and one ally for the rest of the interaction, smoothing routine checks they control.
career_faceman_human_gate_hand_off_rules: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After observing a digital or mechanical check (scanner, scrip reader, mag-lock keypad), you route it to manual adjudication. career_faceman_interruption_play_rules-u: Type: Reaction (before ally’s roll) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When an ally is about to be screened or questioned, you interject and take the test using Deception, Persuade, or Disguise (choose). If immediate follow-up scrutiny happens, it targets you.
career_faceman_introductions_on_me_rules: Type: Maneuver • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you establish a plausible purpose, choose up to two allies. Their first social test with this group this scene gains a bonus die.
career_faceman_make_it_official_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Create/edit an on-the-spot credential or token (House writ, work order, visitor slip, salvage chit, scrip voucher). career_faceman_master_cue_rules-u: Type: Reaction (before roll) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Feed lines and framing to an ally making Deception, Persuade, or Disguise. They may use your corresponding skill if higher. If immediate follow-up scrutiny occurs, it targets you.
career_faceman_master_of_disguise_rules-: Type: Downtime prep → Scene effect • Usage: 1/Session — With ≥10 minutes of prep before the scene, you auto-succeed vs. casual scrutiny for the entire scene. career_faceman_one_conversation_rule_rul: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — At a single point of contact this scene, pre-resolve scrutiny: choose up to two foreseeable, similar checks (e.g., sign-in + asset tag; wristband scan + bag glance). career_faceman_pass_token_clone_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After observing/handling a valid badge/token/wristband this scene, roll Electronics or Security Systems. On success, the clone passes one comparable scrutiny this scene (Hard: two). Hands-on inspection defeats a clone.
career_faceman_prompting_whisper_rules-u: Type: Reaction (declare before ally’s roll) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — Feed a line or cue to an ally making Deception, Persuade, or Disguise. They gain a bonus die. If immediate follow-up scrutiny occurs, it targets you.
career_faceman_senior_voice_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Address a non-officer gatekeeper in earshot. Persuade vs. POW. On success, they treat you as a temporary superior for the rest of this interaction: open a door, issue a handoff, begin an escort. Won’t force illegal orders; supervisors resist with a bonus die.
career_faceman_small_team_protocol_reset: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Address up to three professionals in earshot (guards, ushers, stewards, wardens). Persuade vs. average POW. On success, for the rest of this immediate conversation, they revert to a non-hostile standard procedure you name (“resume patrol,” “await supervisor,” “escort to intake”). No effect once violence starts.
career_faceman_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_faceman_token_familiarity_rules-u: Type: Passive • Usage: 1/Scene — Once per scene, when any belonging token is presented (House scrip band, union chit, clinic band, clan bead), you skip one secondary “prove-it” step (random quiz, second scan, code phrase) without a roll.
career_faceman_walkthrough_doctrine_rule: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When challenged at a point of contact (corp lobby, House outpost, scav gate), roll Deception or Persuade. On success, that challenge is treated as routine for you and one ally for the rest of the interaction with that gatekeeper this scene (Hard: up to two allies). Does not affect active violence.
career_hexbreaker_break_the_pattern_rule: Type: Action (Disruption) • Cost: 1d6 + 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You slam your Bound Focus into the flow of the fight, fracturing timing and coordination. Choose one opponent you are Engaged with. Until the end of the current Round, all hostile opponents within Short range of that opponent suffer the following effects: they cannot benefit from Assist actions; they suffer 1 penalty die on the first Reaction they attempt this Round; and any opponent that moves, disengages, or changes targets during this Round suffers –10% to their next roll before the end of their next turn. After this effect ends, you are Shaken until the start of your next turn.
career_hexbreaker_breakers_reversal_rule: Type: Free Action (Rider) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You successfully land a Fight Back against an opponent Engaged with you using your Bound Focus. After resolving the Fight Back normally, the target suffers +1d6 physical damage and is Impaired until the start of its next turn. This additional damage is not a separate attack, cannot be opposed, and does not trigger reactions.
career_hexbreaker_claim_the_exchange_rul: Type: Free Action (Commitment) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: At-will — At the start of your turn, while you are Engaged with an opponent, you may commit to the exchange. Until the start of your next turn, the first time that opponent makes a melee or unarmed attack against you, you gain +10% on any Fight Back reaction made against that attack. If you disengage before this triggers, the effect ends with no benefit.
career_hexbreaker_close_in_guard_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An opponent within Short range that is not Engaged with you targets an ally with an attack. Impose 1 penalty die on the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you may immediately Shift to become Engaged with the attacker, provided you can reach them. This movement does not trigger reactions.
career_hexbreaker_crack_the_timing_rules: Type: Maneuver (Hex) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose an opponent Engaged with you. Until the start of your next turn, the first Reaction that opponent attempts automatically suffers 1 penalty die. If that Reaction fails, it is still spent.
career_hexbreaker_disruptive_grip_rules-: Type: Reaction (Interrupt) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An opponent Engaged with you attempts to disengage, reposition, or use a movement ability. Roll your Melee Weapons or Unarmed Combat opposed by the opponent’s Dodge or Athletics. On a success, the movement occurs but the target suffers 1 penalty die on its next roll before the end of its turn. On a Hard Success, the movement fails and the target remains Engaged.
career_hexbreaker_edge_of_attrition_rule: Type: Action (Stance) • Cost: 1d6 Strain to enter; 1 Strain per Round to maintain • Usage: 1/Session — You enter a duelist’s stance against an opponent you are Engaged with. Choose one opponent you are Engaged with; the stance lasts while you remain Engaged with that opponent and continue to pay the upkeep cost. While active: (1) You gain +10% on all Fight Back reactions against the chosen opponent. (2) The chosen opponent suffers –10% to all melee or unarmed attacks against targets other than you. (3) The first time each Round you and the chosen opponent both succeed on opposed melee checks against each other, your success tier is treated as one step higher. This stance does not stack with other stance-based, zone-based, or threat-enforcing effects. The stance ends immediately if you disengage, lose Engaged status, fail to pay upkeep, or choose a new target. When the stance ends, you are Impaired until the start of your next turn.
career_hexbreaker_faultline_strike_rules: Type: Free Action (Hex) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you hit an opponent Engaged with you using your Bound Focus, you may declare Faultline Strike. After damage is resolved, choose one of the following effects to apply to the target until the start of its next turn: –10% to all attacks, –10% to all defenses, or 1 penalty die on its next Reaction. This effect represents structural failure in the target’s stance, wards, or systems and does not stack with itself.
career_hexbreaker_final_rend_rules-u: Type: Action (Execution) • Cost: 1d6 + 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You must be Engaged with an opponent you have already hit this Scene using your Bound Focus. Make a single melee attack with your Bound Focus against that opponent. On a hit, the attack deals arcane damage and gains +2d6 damage. Damage is reduced only by the opponent’s arcane damage reduction. If this attack reduces the opponent to half HP or lower, they are Staggered until the end of their next turn. After resolving this attack, you lose all Reactions and suffer 1 penalty die on all defenses until the start of your next turn. This attack cannot benefit from other Hex or Rider effects.
career_hexbreaker_fracture_edge_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Hex) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: This strike only — When you hit with a melee attack using your Bound Focus, you may reduce the damage dealt by 2. If you do, the target suffers –10% to its next attack or defense roll before the end of its next turn. If the target relies on active wards, reactive shielding, or similar protections, apply the penalty as –20% instead.
career_hexbreaker_lockstep_advance_rules: Type: Free Action (Bind) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: This exchange only — When you enter Engaged range with a target using your Bound Focus, you may declare Lockstep Advance. Until the end of the current exchange, neither you nor the target may disengage without spending an Action. If either of you disengages this way, the other may immediately Shift one range band to follow.
career_hexbreaker_marked_by_contact_rule: Type: Free Action (Bind) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you hit an opponent with a melee attack using your Bound Focus, you may Mark that target until the start of your next turn. While Marked, the target suffers –10% to all attacks and defenses against opponents other than you. This Mark ends immediately if you disengage.
career_hexbreaker_oath_of_the_breach_rul: Type: Action (Vow) • Cost: 1d6 + 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one opponent you can see and name them as your breach. Until the end of the Scene, while you and the chosen opponent are within Medium range of each other, the following effects apply: (1) The first time each Round the chosen opponent attacks, disengages, or targets someone other than you, they immediately become Shaken. (2) The first time each Round you hit the chosen opponent with a melee attack using your Bound Focus, you may either clear Shaken from yourself or gain +10% on your next melee or Fight Back roll against that opponent before the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you become Incapacitated, voluntarily retreat beyond Medium range, or choose to end the vow as a Free Action.
career_hexbreaker_press_the_fault_rules-: Type: Maneuver (Hex) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose a target Engaged with you while using your Bound Focus. Until the start of your next turn, the first time that target would gain a bonus die, ignore a penalty die, or receive a defensive benefit from an active protection effect, it instead suffers 1 penalty die on that roll. Active protection effects are limited to abilities or effects that explicitly grant bonus dice, negate penalty dice, provide reaction-based defense, or apply conditional damage reduction. Passive armor, static soak, and always-on equipment do not qualify. This talent does not remove effects and applies only once.
career_hexbreaker_punishing_focus_rules-: Type: Passive • Usage: At-will — While you are Engaged with an opponent using your Bound Focus, that opponent suffers –10% to all attack rolls that do not target you. This penalty ends immediately if you are no longer Engaged with that opponent. This effect does not stack with other targeting or threat-based penalties.
career_hexbreaker_rend_the_ward_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Hex) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: This strike only — When you hit with a melee attack using your Bound Focus, you may declare Rend the Ward. Until the end of the current Round, the target cannot benefit from arcane wards, reactive shielding, or effects that grant bonus dice to defense against attacks made by you. This does not dispel effects; it suppresses their benefit against your attacks only.
career_hexbreaker_shatter_the_seal_rules: Type: Free Action (Hex) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: This strike only — When you hit an opponent with a melee attack using your Bound Focus, you may declare Shatter the Seal. For this attack, reduce the target’s total physical damage reduction from armor, wards, and similar protective effects by 2, to a minimum of the target’s base physical soak. If the target relied on arcane protection or reactive shielding, they also suffer 1 penalty die on their next defense roll before the end of their next turn. This effect applies only to this attack and does not dispel or suppress ongoing effects.
career_hexbreaker_stand_the_line_rules-u: Type: Action (Stance) • Cost: 1d6 Strain to enter; 1 Strain per Round to maintain • Usage: 1/Session — You plant yourself and dare the fight to break on you. Until the stance ends, you project a Short-radius threat zone centered on you. While active: (1) Hostile opponents within the zone suffer –10% to all attacks against targets other than you. (2) The first time each Round an opponent within the zone attacks a target other than you, you may immediately take a Free Action to move one range band toward that opponent (ending Engaged if applicable). (3) The first time each Round you are hit by an attack while this stance is active, reduce the damage by 1d6 (after DR). This stance does not stack with other stance-based, zone-based, or threat-enforcing effects. The stance ends immediately if you are moved unwillingly, become Incapacitated, or fail to pay the upkeep cost. When the stance ends, you are Shaken until the start of your next turn.
career_hexbreaker_stay_the_blade_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An opponent Engaged with you hits you with a melee attack. Reduce the damage by 2, then impose –10% on that opponent’s next attack roll before the end of its next turn. If the triggering attack relied on a bonus die, the penalty is instead –20%.
career_hexbreaker_turn_the_guard_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Counter) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An opponent Engaged with you successfully Dodges or Parries your melee attack. Immediately impose –10% on that opponent’s next attack roll before the end of its next turn. If the defense relied on a Reaction, that opponent also suffers 1 penalty die on its next Reaction before the end of its next turn.
career_icon_all_eyes_on_me_rules-u: Type: Action (Compel) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Seize the emotional spotlight. All NPCs within Medium who can see or hear you must roll POW. On a failure, they’re compelled to direct their next verbal or physical action toward you if applicable, or suffer Impaired for 1 round. Hostile combatants gain +1 bonus die to resist.
career_icon_burn_it_brighter_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Defiant Surge) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: During a high-stakes moment (public confrontation, broadcast moment, crisis, rally, or active threat scene), when you or an ally within Short fails an Action that was affected by one or more penalty dice. Effect: The triggering roll is immediately rerolled using the same dice pool, including all original bonus and penalty dice. The new result replaces the original.
career_icon_burning_signature_rules-u: Type: Passive (Fame) • Usage: 1/Scene — The first time each scene you leverage your recognized persona, voice, or work against a character who has encountered you before, gain +20% to that social roll. This effect lasts only for the triggering roll.
career_icon_command_the_stage_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Performance Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you perform before a group (live or broadcast), choose one for the rest of the scene: gain +1 bonus die to Charm, Persuade, or Leadership; or the next hostile social roll made by the audience suffers 1 penalty die.
career_icon_crowd_momentum_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Carryover) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful Perform that captures audience attention, gain +1 bonus die on your next Persuade, Charm, or Leadership roll this scene.
career_icon_crowdcarver_rules-u: Type: Action (Field Tone) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Declare an emotional tone (e.g., fear, reverence, defiance, serenity) for the scene involving a group. That group adopts the tone for the remainder of the scene unless hostile individuals pass POW. This doesn’t compel behavior but tilts reactions to persuasion, fear, and influence.
career_icon_cultural_gravity_rules-u: Type: Passive (Downtime) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +20% to downtime performance rolls to earn credits, build audiences, or influence venues. Applies to DreamFeed contracts, underground showcases, or professional bookings.
career_icon_echo_beyond_the_feed_rules-u: Type: Action (Invoke Memory) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After a scene in which you performed or left a strong impression, automatically succeed on one Charm or Persuade roll (not Deception) against a witness (live or via feed). This cannot compel actions that would be fundamentally against the target’s nature, loyalties, or immediate survival instincts.
career_icon_emotional_contagion_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Shift Attitude) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you successfully sway an audience, one NPC observer shifts from Neutral → Friendly for the rest of the scene.
career_icon_encore_effect_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Reroll/Boost) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you fail a Perform check, reroll it. If the reroll succeeds, grant +10% to the next roll of one ally or NPC who observed it this scene.
career_icon_encore_of_will_rules-u: Type: Action (Cleanse) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Remove Panicked and Suppressed from allies within Medium who can see or hear you.
career_icon_endurance_conditioning_rules: Type: Passive (Resilience) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Gain +2 maximum HP.
career_icon_hold_the_line_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Rally Under Fire) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you or an ally within Short drops to 50% HP or less during a hostile scene, you seize the moment to keep morale from breaking. Choose one ally who can see or hear you. That ally may immediately ignore one penalty die on their next Action this round that directly responds to the threat that caused the trigger.
career_icon_iconic_rally_rules-u: Type: Action (Rally) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — All allies within Medium who can see or hear you instantly recover 1d4 Strain.
career_icon_living_legend_rules-u: Type: Action (Narrative Authority) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you enter a social or public scene involving individuals or groups familiar with your reputation, declare Living Legend. Until the end of the scene, hostile social rolls made against you suffer 1 penalty die, and allies gain +10% on social rolls that directly invoke your legacy, name, or prior deeds. This does not compel behavior or override loyalties.
career_icon_neurolinked_presence_rules-u: Type: Passive (Feed) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While performing through a DreamFeed/emotion-sync venue, gain +10% to Perform or Charm for the scene. Applies to both live and recorded feeds.
career_icon_pulse_of_the_crowd_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Recover) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After a successful Perform check, regain 1d4 Strain.
career_icon_resonant_persona_rules-u: Type: Passive (Persona) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Create a named performance persona (look/theme/emotional arc). While performing in-character, gain +10% to Perform, Charm, or Persuade. Only one active Persona at a time; may be taken again to maintain an additional Persona.
career_icon_shared_spotlight_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Closer) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Deliver a closing performance/rally at scene end. Allies who witnessed it recover an additional 1d4 Strain during their next short rest.
career_icon_showstopper_rules-u: Type: Passive (Substitution) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When initiating a performance or seizing attention, you may roll Perform instead of Deception or Intimidate to distract, misdirect, or engage a crowd.
career_icon_signature_crescendo_rules-u: Type: Action (Climax) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Transform a Perform or Persuade roll into a defining moment. On a success, all targets influenced by it become more receptive: you gain +10% to all further social rolls with them for the rest of the scene. In addition, choose one NPC or group affected; their attitude toward you cannot worsen for the remainder of the session unless you betray or directly harm them.
career_icon_stagecraft_rules-u: Type: Passive (Downtime) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +10% to downtime performance rolls to earn credits or build influence. May also apply to artistic Networking scenes at GM discretion.
career_icon_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_icon_street_stage_discipline_rule: Type: Passive (Grit) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Ignore 1 penalty die to Perform when performing in chaotic/crowded/dangerous environments (combat zones, underground clubs, protests, etc.).
career_icon_this_moment_will_be_remember: Type: Passive (Narrative Weight) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Once per session, when a scene ends in which you played a visible role, you may declare this talent. Choose one significant NPC, faction, or audience present. For future scenes in which that NPC, faction, or audience is directly involved, the first roll you make to influence, rally, or sway them gains 1 bonus die, as the memory of this moment lingers.
career_icon_voice_of_the_moment_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Rally) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — During a high-stakes moment (negotiation, crisis, rally), grant +10% to all allies’ next social roll this scene.
career_investigator_absolute_reconstruct: Type: Action • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After concentrating for one full Round at a location or over a dataset you have examined this Scene, roll Investigation; on a success, ask the GM up to three specific questions about the sequence of the most recent significant event that occurred there within the last hour, with answers limited to what can be inferred from physical, digital, or arcane evidence and without revealing hidden intent. Until the end of the Scene, the first allied Action that directly exploits one of these answers gains +1 bonus die.
career_investigator_anchor_the_moment_ru: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When an ally within Short range fails a Perception, Insight, or Investigation check, you may spend 1 Strain to allow them to reroll the check and take the new result.
career_investigator_anticipated_response: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After a creature you have used Focused Subject on declares an action, you may spend 1 Strain to gain +1 bonus die on your next roll made directly in response to that action this Round.
career_investigator_broad_spectrum_asses: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — For the remainder of the Scene, gain +1 bonus die on Investigation and Perception checks; this does not negate penalty dice and does not apply to combat attacks.
career_investigator_casefile_momentum_ru: Type: Passive (Momentum) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — The first time each scene that you succeed on an Investigation, Insight, or Perception check that reveals a meaningful lead, contradiction, or vulnerability, choose one: gain +1 bonus die on your next Action that directly follows from that discovery or allow one ally who can hear you to gain +1 bonus die on their next Action that exploits it.
career_investigator_clean_entry_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Reduce difficulty by one step on a Security Systems or Mechanics test to bypass a lock or alarm.
career_investigator_clean_execution_rule: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When benefiting from Methodical Approach or Deliberate Follow-Up, you may also remove one complication or drawback imposed by the GM on a Success (not a failure) related to that investigation.
career_investigator_cold_case_instinct_r: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Once per Session, when a Scene ends without resolving a central question you were actively investigating, you retain one unresolved lead; the next time that lead becomes relevant, gain +1 bonus die on the first Investigation, Insight, or Interrogation check made to pursue it.
career_investigator_crack_the_mask_rules: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — During a social interaction, after succeeding on Exploit Tension, roll Insight opposed by the target’s Deception or Willpower. On a success, the target cannot take bonus dice on social rolls against you for the remainder of the Scene.
career_investigator_decisive_leverage_ru: Type: Action • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — During a social confrontation, after succeeding on an opposed social roll against a target you have engaged earlier this Scene, choose up to three allies who can see or hear the exchange. The next opposed social roll made by each chosen ally against that target this Scene gains +1 bonus die. This does not compel behavior or force truthful answers.
career_investigator_deliberate_follow_up: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you fail an Investigation or Perception check that benefited from Methodical Approach, you may spend 1 Strain to ask the GM one narrowly scoped follow-up question about what your attempt almost revealed; the answer may be partial or uncertain and does not convert the failure into a success.
career_investigator_exploit_tension_rule: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — During a social interaction, after succeeding with Pressure Point, spend 1 Strain to impose one penalty die on the target’s next social roll this Scene that directly opposes you.
career_investigator_focused_subject_rule: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After successfully using Read the Room on a target, your next non-damaging action against that target this Scene (including Setups, Maneuvers, and Social Actions) gains +1 bonus die.
career_investigator_forensic_flashback_r: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After examining a location for one Round, roll Investigation. On success, ask one specific question about the last major event.
career_investigator_initial_read_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After entering a new scene or environment, make an Investigation or Perception check. On a success, the GM reveals one notable inconsistency, omission, or detail that does not fit the apparent situation.
career_investigator_investigators_poise_: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When Surprised, spend 2 Strain to roll normal Initiative (no penalty die). You still cannot take Reactions until your first turn.
career_investigator_methodical_approach_: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you take at least one full Round to examine evidence, a location, or records before acting, ignore one penalty die on your next Investigation or Perception check related to that subject.
career_investigator_moment_of_truth_rule: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — In a social scene, Opposed Insight vs. Deception. On success, target becomes Exposed (Social) for the Scene: you and allies gain +1 bonus die on social checks vs. them.
career_investigator_operational_override: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When a Scene pivots due to a revealed clue, contradiction, or discovery you directly uncovered this Scene, you may immediately allow yourself and up to two allies within Close range to each take one Maneuver outside the normal turn order. These Maneuvers cannot be used to attack or cast spells and must be resolved immediately or the opportunity is lost.
career_investigator_poised_under_fire_ru: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you would be Surprised, you may spend 2 Strain to act normally during the first Round, but you cannot make Reactions until after your first turn.
career_investigator_predictive_motive_ru: Type: Reaction • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When a creature takes a meaningful action, study them. Your next Insight, attack, or social action vs. that creature gains +1 bonus die.
career_investigator_preemptive_positioni: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When combat begins, you may spend 2 Strain to either move one range increment or gain +1 bonus die on your first Dodge or Fight Back Reaction this Scene.
career_investigator_pressure_point_rules: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — During a social interaction, make an opposed Insight vs. Deception or Persuade. On a success, your next social check against the target this Scene gains +1 bonus die.
career_investigator_read_the_room_rules-: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one individual you can observe. Gain +20% Insight on your next check targeting that individual this Scene.
career_investigator_ready_before_it_brea: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When Situational Awareness applies, you may also draw a weapon or take cover as part of the same Reaction.
career_investigator_reconstructive_pass_: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After examining a location, object, or records for one full Round, roll Investigation. On a success, ask the GM one specific question about the most recent significant action taken there. The answer must be grounded in available evidence, not hidden intent.
career_investigator_resonance_trace_rule: Type: Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After successfully using Initial Read in a scene involving magic or Veil effects, gain +20% Arcana for the remainder of the Scene to identify magical signatures, disturbances, or their general direction of origin.
career_investigator_situational_awarenes: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When initiative is rolled and you are not Surprised, spend 1 Strain to gain +10% on your Initiative roll.
