career_investigator_temporal_intuition_r: Type: Action • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Roll Insight. On a success, the GM describes one major event likely to occur within the next hour if no meaningful intervention takes place, framed as a probable outcome rather than a certainty.
career_investigator_veil_discontinuity_s: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you encounter magical or Veil-based deception, illusions, or obfuscation, you may roll Insight or Arcana; on a success, you recognize the presence of falsification and gain +20% on your next action taken to analyze or counter its source.
career_marksman_aim_lock_rules-u: Type: Passive (when disrupted) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — If you would lose Focused Aim due to Dodge or minor forced movement, spend 2 Strain to maintain Focused Aim into your next turn. You still resolve the Dodge at –10% and cannot take other actions that round.
career_marksman_braced_position_rules-u: Type: Maneuver • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Become Braced. While Braced, Single Shot rifle attacks are +10%. Moving breaks Braced. Does not stack with Steady Breath.
career_marksman_cold_bore_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Your first rifle attack each scene that follows Quick Aim or Focused Aim gains +1 damage on a hit.
career_marksman_counter_sniper_drill_rul: Type: Reaction • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When targeted from Long/Extreme, make Perception vs. attacker’s Stealth. On success, you pinpoint their position and gain +10% to your first attack against them before your next turn ends.
career_marksman_counter_sniper_protocol_: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When hit by an unseen shooter and you have any valid pin/fix (Counter-Sniper Drill, drone mark, ally callout), make an immediate Single Shot at –20% as a Reaction against their traced position.
career_marksman_dead_line_rules-u: Type: Special post-shot • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After an uninterrupted Focused Aim, declare Dead Line: choose two visible enemies that are within your front arc and within one range band of each other (Medium or farther from you). Make one rifle attack at –10%; on a hit, both targets take normal weapon damage (roll damage once, apply to both). This attack cannot impale. (Cover and range modifiers apply separately to the roll as normal.)
career_marksman_ghillie_mastery_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While stationary and not firing, attempts to locate you at Medium+ range suffer 1 penalty die. Gain +10% Stealth to remain unseen during observation/relocation before you shoot.
career_marksman_glint_trap_rules-u: Type: Reaction • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When a Long/Extreme-range shooter misses you, their next attack against you this scene suffers 1 penalty die.
career_marksman_impossible_shot_rules-u:
Type: Attack • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After an uninterrupted Focused Aim, you may attempt a shot at a target up to two range bands beyond your weapon’s listed maximum (never beyond Extreme). Apply the normal range modifier for the target’s actual. In addition, apply one penalty die for each band beyond your weapon’s maximum. Your Focused Aim bonus die cancels one penalty die, if present.

On any hit, treat the attack as a critical (impale) for damage. On a fumble, your position is revealed.
career_marksman_kill_chain_rules-u: Type: Special immediate • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you hit with a rifle attack that followed Focused Aim, make one additional Single Shot at a different target within Short of the original target’s position at –10%. It does not benefit from Focused Aim and cannot impale regardless of success level. Overrides Single-Shot’s once/turn limit.
career_marksman_kill_confirmed_rules-u: Type: Passive (after hit) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After a Focused Aim rifle hit, upgrade it to critical (impale). If it was already Extreme/Critical, instead add Armor Piercing 4 to that attack.
career_marksman_lockdown_shot_rules-u: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare before rolling. On a hit with a Single Shot rifle, trade –1d6 damage to inflict the Hobbled Condition (movement halved) until the start of the target’s next turn.
career_marksman_one_shot_doctrine_rules-: Type: Passive (on hit) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When a Focused Aim rifle attack hits with a Hard Success or better, it bypasses all physical armor for damage resolution (treat Armor as 0).
career_marksman_overwatch_architect_rule: Type: Action (set) + Reaction (interrupts) • Cost: 1 Strain per interrupt shot • Usage: 1/Scene — While stationary, set Overwatch on your front arc to your weapon’s range until your next turn. Any enemy that becomes visible in that arc must test POW for Suppression (capstone exception to FA rule). As one Reaction, make up to three interrupt rifle attacks against Suppressed targets that move, at 0% / –10% / –20%. You forgo all other Reactions while Overwatch is active.
career_marksman_quiet_reload_rules-u: Type: Free Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — If Hidden or Braced, reload a rifle as a Free Action instead of a Maneuver.
career_marksman_range_gate_rules-u: Type: Declare before attack • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Treat the target as one range band closer for penalties (cannot enable out-of-range shots).
career_marksman_recon_uplink_rules-u: Type: Maneuver • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — With a scout drone active, make Drone Operations; on success, apply Spotter’s Mark to a target your drone sees at Long range.
career_marksman_relocation_drill_rules-u: Type: Free Action (after your Focused Aim rifle attack resolves) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will - Immediately take a Move Maneuver to shift one range band. This does not grant hiding, does not ignore Disengage, and cannot be used while Engaged (you must disengage normally).
career_marksman_ricochet_geometry_rules-: Type: Attack • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Requires Focused Aim. If a plausible hard surface/angle exists, target an enemy behind Full Cover (GM Approval) via a banked shot. Make the attack at –10% and 1 penalty die; you ignore cover entirely for this shot (no LOS block and no cover-derived penalties). Range modifiers still apply. On a fumble, the shot is lost and you’re revealed.
career_marksman_sidearm_bailout_rules-u: Type: Reaction • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When an enemy enters or begins Engaged with you, as a Reaction you can immediately draw and fire one handgun attack at them with 1 penalty die. No Aim benefits. Overrides normal draw timing.
career_marksman_spotters_mark_rules-u: Type: Maneuver • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Make Perception to designate a visible target at Medium+. On success, you and allies gain +10% to hit that target with ranged attacks until your next turn starts.
career_marksman_stat_boost_rules-u: Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_marksman_steady_breath_rules-u: Type: Passive (after Quick Aim) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Your next rifle attack that benefits from any Aim gains +10%. If the attack benefits from Focused Aim, this +10% stacks with Focused Aim’s +10% for +20% total (and you still get Focused Aim’s bonus die). Does not stack with Braced Position—use the higher flat bonus between Steady Breath or Braced.
career_marksman_through_and_through_rule: Type: Special immediate • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — If your rifle attack disables the target (kill or incapacitate), immediately make a second rifle attack at a different enemy within Short of the original target’s position at –10%. The follow-up inherits your current Aim state (including Focused Aim bonus die/+10% if active) and gains Armor Piercing 2. Overrides Single-Shot limit.
career_marksman_windcall_rules-u: Type: Passive (declare before a Focused Aim shot) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one for that attack: remove the penalty die imposed by partial cover, or treat the target as one range band closer for penalties (cannot exceed the weapon’s max band).
career_mindbender_blind_angle_rules-u: Type: Action (Exploit) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose one creature within Short that can see or hear you. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, until the start of your next turn, the target cannot benefit from cover or elevation and suffers 1 penalty die on its first Action.
career_mindbender_catch_22_rules-u: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature within Short targets you or an ally. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the creature’s POW. On a success, the triggering Action suffers 1 penalty die, and the creature cannot take Reactions until the start of its next turn.
career_mindbender_commanding_presence_ru: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose up to two creatures within Short that can see or hear you. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by each target’s POW. On a success, until the start of your next turn, the target cannot use Reactions and is limited to one Maneuver on its turn.
career_mindbender_cracking_resolve_rules: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Choose up to three hostile creatures within Short that can see or hear you. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by each target’s POW. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on its next Action and loses its first Reaction before the start of your next turn.
career_mindbender_false_choice_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Roll Deception, Persuade, or Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, until the end of the target’s next turn, the target must choose either to take an Action or to move on its turn, not both. This does not prevent the use of Reactions.
career_mindbender_fractured_reality_rule: Type: Action (Mind Break) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one creature within Short that can see or hear you and roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, until the end of the scene, the target suffers 1 penalty die on all Actions, cannot benefit from cover, elevation, or similar positional advantages, and the first time each round it attempts to take a Reaction, it must succeed on a POW roll or lose that Reaction. On a failure, these effects instead last until the end of the target’s next turn. The target remains aware but cannot reliably distinguish reality from hallucination.
career_mindbender_hidden_intent_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: +1 Strain to the spell • Usage: At-will — When casting an Enchantment spell, you may obscure its intent. Observers must succeed on Insight opposed by your Magic (Enchantment) to recognize the spell as manipulative.
career_mindbender_inevitable_choice_rule: Type: Action (Dominate) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one creature within Short and roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, you take direct control of the target until the end of its next turn, choosing its movement, Action, and Maneuvers as if it were acting willingly. You may not force the use of once-per-session abilities, consumables, or self-destructive actions. When control ends, the target is fully aware its will was overridden. After this effect ends, you cannot use Enchantment spells or Mindbender talents that influence thoughts or emotions until the end of your next turn, and you suffer 1 penalty die on all social rolls for the remainder of the scene.
career_mindbender_memory_spike_rules-u: Type: Action (Disrupt) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Force a target within Short to recall a vivid traumatic or confusing memory. On a failed POW, they lose their next Maneuver.
career_mindbender_mental_backlash_rules-: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature successfully resists one of your social skill or Magic (Enchantment) rolls. Until the end of its next turn, the first Action it takes resolves at the end of the Initiative order. This applies once, to the next Action only, and does not alter Initiative permanently.
career_mindbender_mental_interference_ru: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature within Short begins casting a spell; roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, impose 1 penalty die on that spellcasting roll.
career_mindbender_moment_of_doubt_rules-: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature within Short targets you or an ally with an Action. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the creature’s POW. On a success, the triggering Action suffers 1 penalty die.
career_mindbender_moments_hesitation_rul: Type: Reaction • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature successfully resists one of your Magic (Enchantment) rolls. Effect: Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, the creature may still act normally but cannot use Reactions until the start of its next turn.
career_mindbender_overextension_rules-u: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature fails a roll directly opposed by you. The creature loses its next Maneuver before the end of its next turn.
career_mindbender_overwhelming_urge_rule: Type: Action (Mass Compulsion) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one simple directive (such as fight, flee, hold position, pursue, or protect a specific target) and any number of hostile creatures within Medium that can see or hear you. Each target rolls POW to resist. On a failure, the creature is compelled to pursue the directive for the remainder of the scene. At the start of each affected creature’s turn, it may attempt to resist again with a POW roll; on a success, the compulsion ends for that creature. The creature retains control of its Actions and may act intelligently, but will not willingly act against the directive while affected.
career_mindbender_planted_certainty_rule: Type: Action (Imprint Belief) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one creature within Short and roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. Effect: On a success, you implant a single plausible belief about the current situation. Until the end of the scene, the target treats this belief as true when making decisions, rationalizing contradictory information rather than rejecting it outright. This belief does not override direct sensory evidence, compel specific actions, or alter identity or loyalties.
career_mindbender_press_the_advantage_ru: Type: Free Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: After you succeed on a social skill or Magic (Enchantment) roll against a target. Your next opposed roll this scene directly opposed by that same target gains +1 bonus die.
career_mindbender_read_the_room_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Assess) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After observing a target’s behavior or exchanging words with them, roll Insight opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, the GM answers one question truthfully about the target’s current emotional driver, confidence level, or motivation, and whether they are inclined to escalate, withdraw, or deflect under pressure this scene.
career_mindbender_seed_of_doubt_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Seed) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — During an interaction, roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on the next roll this scene that is directly opposed by you.
career_mindbender_shaken_resolve_rules-u: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A creature successfully resists one of your social skills or Magic (Enchantment) rolls. Effect: The next roll that creature makes before the end of its next turn that is directly opposed by you suffers 1 penalty die.
career_mindbender_spatial_misjudgment_ru: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Target one creature within Short range. Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, until the start of your next turn, the target cannot benefit from cover, elevation, or other positional modifiers on its Actions. This does not remove cover or terrain, only the mechanical benefits.
career_mindbender_split_focus_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Roll Magic (Enchantment) opposed by the target’s POW. On a success, the next Action the target takes before the start of your next turn suffers 1 penalty die, then this effect ends.
career_mindbender_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.
career_mindbender_subtle_suggestion_rule: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Before casting an Enchantment spell that influences thoughts or emotions, gain +1 bonus die on the spellcasting roll.
career_mindbender_turn_the_knife_rules-u: Type: Free Action • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When a creature within Short suffers a penalty die or limitation caused by one of your Mindbender talents, choose one allied creature within Short. That ally may immediately take one Maneuver that does not provoke Reactions.
career_mindbender_unassailable_mind_rule: Type: Reaction • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are targeted by a social effect, Enchantment spell, interrogation, intimidation, or any attempt to influence, read, or destabilize your mental or emotional state. Effect: The triggering effect automatically fails. Until the end of the scene, hostile creatures cannot gain actionable insight into your thoughts, emotions, intentions, or leverage through social skills or mind-affecting effects. Attempts may still occur, but they provide no mechanical or narrative advantage.
career_operator_close_quarters_ready_rul: Type: Free Action (CQB) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — This attack only: Reduce the close-quarters penalty by one step when firing at Engaged with a firearm that normally suffers CQB penalties.
career_operator_combat_presence_rules-u: Type: Passive (Aura) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While not Suppressed and not behind Full Cover, allies within Short gain +10% to Dodge and POW rolls against Suppression.
career_operator_combat_stride_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you hit with a ranged attack, take one Move Maneuver. This movement does not trigger reactions.
career_operator_controlled_pair_rules-u: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When firing in Semi-Auto, reduce the penalty die on your second shot by one step.
career_operator_cover_discipline_rules-u: Type: Passive (Cover) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you Dodge while in Cover, gain +1 bonus die on that Dodge.
career_operator_deadzone_entry_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (CQB) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you move into Engaged, ignore CQB penalties for your next Handgun/SMG attack. The shot must be taken immediately after entering.
career_operator_endurance_conditioning_r: Type: Passive (Resilience) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Gain +2 maximum HP.
career_operator_fire_and_fade_rules-u: Type: Passive (Stride Upgrade) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you use Combat Stride, you may move one range band and automatically enter Cover as part of that movement. This movement does not trigger reactions.
career_operator_grim_resolve_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Ignore) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you roll a Malfunction result or suffer a suppressive effect, ignore it.
career_operator_hard_coded_reflexes_rule: Type: Reaction (Clear Jam) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: Your firearm malfunctions. Effect: Attempt to clear it as a Free Action (requires a successful firearm skill roll to clear).
career_operator_kinetic_retaliation_rule: Type: Reaction (Return Fire) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are hit by a ranged attack while in Partial Cover. Effect: Make a Handgun/SMG attack before applying damage. If it hits, reduce the damage you take by 2 (min 1).
career_operator_lockstep_execution_rules: Type: Free Action (Team Tactics) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you and an ally both target the same enemy during a round, your next attack against that target gains +1 bonus die. On a hit, that ally may reposition 1 range band as a Free Maneuver.
career_operator_precision_reacquired_rul: Type: Special immediate (Reroll) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After a failed ranged attack, reroll it. On success, add +1 damage.
career_operator_quick_reload_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Reload) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Reload a firearm as a Free Action instead of a Maneuver.
career_operator_quickdraw_rules-u: Type: Action (Draw & Fire) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Draw and fire a Handgun or SMG as a single Action. Cannot be used if Surprised.
career_operator_rapid_clearance_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Evade) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful ranged attack while not Engaged, make a free Dodge. On success, you may move one range band as a Free Action.
career_operator_saturation_fire_rules-u: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When firing Burst Fire or Full Auto, ignore 1 penalty die on the attack. Does not stack with other effects that reduce penalty dice.
career_operator_shatterpoint_protocol_ru: Type: Special immediate (Damage Boost) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After you hit with Semi-Auto or Burst Fire, roll a second damage roll and choose either result; that attack also ignores 1 Armor.
career_operator_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_operator_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_operator_suppression_discipline_r: Type: Free Action (Suppress) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you miss with Full Auto, treat it as a hit for Suppression only (no damage).
career_operator_sweep_and_reposition_rul: Type: Special immediate (Chain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you down a target with a ranged attack, immediately move 1 range band and make one Burst Fire or Single Shot attack against a new target.
career_operator_tactical_apex_rules-u: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When attacking with a Burst Fire weapon, treat all dice penalties as 0. On a hit, deal +1 damage.
career_operator_tactical_lock_in_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Mark) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you hit a target with a ranged attack, declare Tactical Lock-In. For the next two rounds, you gain +1 bonus die on your next attack against that target each round; during this time, that target suffers 1 penalty die on all attacks vs you.
career_operator_zeroed_vector_killbox_ru: Type: Action (Mark/Killbox) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Declare a Killbox against one enemy within Medium. Until end of round, you and all allies gain +1 bonus die when targeting that enemy with ranged attacks. If you strike first, deal +2 bonus damage on your attack.
career_pilot_aerial_pivot_shot_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Shot on the Move) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — While piloting or drone-rigged, fire one handheld ranged weapon as a Free Action during vehicle movement/repositioning; ignore penalty dice for unstable footing/active motion.
career_pilot_airspace_denial_vector_rule: Type: Free Action (Zone) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you win Initiative while piloting, designate an aerial zone (Short around your craft/drone). Until your next turn, enemies that enter or act in this zone suffer 1 penalty die on all actions.
career_pilot_burn_vector_gambit_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Reposition + Act) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After a drone or vehicle you control completes its turn, reposition it anywhere within Short, then make one free attack or system action. Ignores overwatch, elevation, and terrain penalties.
career_pilot_combat_integration_mesh_rul: Type: Special immediate (Order Relay) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you hit a target while piloting or rigged, one other drone you control may immediately take one Free Action (move, basic attack, or utility).
career_pilot_combat_rigging_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Deploy) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you deploy a combat-capable drone, it may immediately take one simple action (move, aim, or fire one weapon) as part of the deployment.
career_pilot_deadzone_reflex_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Pre-turn Move) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After Initiative is rolled in vehicle combat/pursuit, move your vehicle 1 range band as a Free Maneuver before anyone acts.
career_pilot_drone_lock_protocol_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Lock-On) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session (to initiate) — After your drone hits, initiate Lock-On to that target. That drone gains +1 bonus die on all further attacks vs. that target. Maintain by spending 2 Strain each round; dropping it ends the Lock-On.
career_pilot_drop_vector_override_rules-: Type: Action (Approach) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — During a rapid/evasive landing approach, all actions targeting your aircraft/drone or anyone onboard suffer 1 penalty die until the start of your next turn. You suffer no vehicle control penalties during this descent.
career_pilot_endurance_conditioning_rule: Type: Passive (Resilience) • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Gain +2 maximum HP (high-G tolerance/Veilstorm turbulence/neural feedback).
career_pilot_jet_wash_drift_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Debuff) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful Piloting evade/maneuver, force one nearby vehicle, drone, or enemy within Short to suffer 1 penalty die on their next Gunnery or Ranged Weapon attack.
career_pilot_overclock_sync_node_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Reroll) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: A drone or piloted vehicle you control fails a roll. Effect: Reroll with +1 bonus die (signal clarity/emergency AI correction).
career_pilot_overdrive_calibration_rules: Type: Free Action (Speed) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Increase the Speed Rating by +1 of a vehicle you are piloting or linked to for one Pursuit/Evasion round. This applies after the Pursuit roll is made.
career_pilot_priority_channel_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Assist) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: Another character fails a Perception, Piloting, or Drone Operation check within Medium. Effect: They reroll with +1 bonus die (live uplink support).
career_pilot_remote_override_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Command) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Issue one immediate command to a drone or linked vehicle: move, interact, or activate a system.
career_pilot_rigsight_linkage_rules-u: Type: Passive (Stabilization) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While piloting or drone-rigged, you ignore penalty dice for firing your own handheld ranged weapons. Also: 1/Session, gain +1 bonus die on one such attack made while actively rigged.
career_pilot_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_pilot_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_pilot_suppressive_vectoring_rules: Type: Reaction (Drone) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: Your drone misses an attack. Effect: Impose 1 penalty die on that target’s next action (erratic movement/suppressive fire control).
career_pilot_swarm_logic_override_rules-: Type: Action (Coordinated Command) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Issue one command simultaneously to all drones you control within Medium. Each drone may take one simple action (move, basic attack, or utility) in any order.
career_pilot_tactical_uplink_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Spot/Assist) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful Perception or Drone Operation roll to spot a threat, choose one ally; that ally’s next attack vs. that target this round gains +1 bonus die.
career_pilot_tethered_assault_ai_rules-u: Type: Action (Activate AI) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Activate a tethered combat subroutine in one drone. For the rest of the scene, it may act independently once per round without a command, using basic attack or movement.
career_pilot_throttle_reflex_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — On your next Piloting or Drone Operation roll this turn to evade danger, escape pursuit, or navigate a hazard (including retreating under fire), gain +1 bonus die.
career_pilot_thruster_kickout_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Mitigate/Displace) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: Your vehicle is hit by an attack. Effect: Halve the damage (round up) and immediately move 1 range band. Declare before damage is rolled.
career_pilot_trace_disruptor_grid_rules-: Type: Reaction (Countermeasures) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are targeted by a Slicing attempt or vehicle lock-on. Effect: Impose 1 penalty die on the attacker’s roll and mask your vehicle/drone’s signature for 1 round.
career_shadowblade_blade_linked_motion_r: Type: Special immediate (Reposition) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you kill a target with a melee or thrown attack, immediately move 1 range band without spending a Maneuver. This movement does not provoke Reactions.
career_shadowblade_blurred_step_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Advance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are targeted by a ranged or melee attack and have not acted yet this round. Effect: After the attack resolves, move 1 range band as a Free Action.
career_shadowblade_cloak_in_motion_rules: Type: Passive (Movement Stealth) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die to Stealth while moving, as long as you take no Action that round other than movement/positioning.
career_shadowblade_cloaked_predator_rule: Type: Passive (Ambush) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While Cloak in Motion is active or while in Stealth, gain +10% to Melee or Thrown attacks vs unaware or distracted targets.
career_shadowblade_crimson_cascade_rules: Type: Passive (Bleed Amp) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Against Bleeding targets, your melee attacks deal +1 damage. If they drop below 50% HP while Bleeding, they lose their next Reaction.
career_shadowblade_crimson_rhythm_rules-: Type: Passive (Bleed Debuff) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Targets Bleeding from your attacks suffer –10% to all physical actions. If they take 2+ damage in a round, their Bleed increases to 2/round next turn.
career_shadowblade_cut_and_vanish_rules-: Type: Special immediate (Disengage) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you hit with a melee attack, Disengage as a Free Action.
career_shadowblade_draw_and_cut_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Follow-up) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you use Throw, Move, Strike, your next melee attack this round gains +10% and ignores penalty dice from Partial Cover or concealment.
career_shadowblade_final_knife_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Curve Throw) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Make one thrown attack as a Free Action against a target within Medium even behind Full Cover; the weapon curves unnaturally (no LOS required).
career_shadowblade_flashing_return_rules: Type: Special immediate (Chain Throw) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After a successful thrown attack, immediately draw and throw a second weapon at a different target within range; the second attack has 1 penalty die.
career_shadowblade_ghost_opener_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare before rolling a melee or thrown attack from Stealth or before the target has acted this round; gain +1 bonus die on that attack.
career_shadowblade_knife_logic_rules-u: Type: Passive (Thrown) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +10% to thrown attacks vs unaware or distracted targets; this becomes +20% if the target has not acted yet this round.
career_shadowblade_knifes_memory_rules-u: Type: Passive (Draw/Initiative) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Once per round, you may draw a melee or thrown weapon as a Free Action. Also, when rolling Initiative in the first round, if armed with a light melee or thrown weapon, gain +1 bonus die.
career_shadowblade_momentum_slice_rules-: Type: Passive (Tempo) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/round — If you move at least 1 range band before making a melee attack, gain +10% on that attack. On a hit, your next Maneuver or Reaction this round costs 1 less Strain to perform.
career_shadowblade_one_among_many_rules-: Type: Passive (Camouflage) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die to Stealth when navigating crowds or dense terrain.
career_shadowblade_phantom_execution_rul: Type: Special immediate (Stealth Attack) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you perform Vanish Step, make one melee or thrown attack from Stealth without breaking Stealth. That attack gains +1 bonus die and +1 damage.
career_shadowblade_phantom_reversal_rule: Type: Reaction (Riposte) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You successfully Dodge a melee attack. Effect: Immediately make one melee attack as a Free Action against the attacker; on a hit, deal +1 damage.
career_shadowblade_precision_hemorrhage_: Type: Special immediate (Bleed) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you land a melee hit with a Hard Success or better, the target begins Bleeding (1 damage/round, 3 rounds or until First Aid).
career_shadowblade_pressure_point_rules-: Type: Special immediate (Debilitate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When your melee or thrown attack is a Hard Success or better, the target suffers 1 penalty die on all physical actions until the start of their next turn.
career_shadowblade_quiet_terror_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Fear) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you kill from Stealth, all enemies within Short must pass POW or suffer –10% to all actions against you until the start of their next turn.
career_shadowblade_shatterpoint_strike_r: Type: Attack modifier • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Declare before rolling a melee or thrown attack. If the target is unaware or below 50% HP, the attack ignores Armor and deals maximum weapon damage on a hit.
career_shadowblade_sightless_kill_rules-: Type: Passive (Low Vis) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — In low visibility (darkness, heavy fog/smoke, magical concealment), if the target cannot clearly perceive you, gain +1 bonus die on attacks. If the target is unaware, your first attack each scene against them deals +1 damage.
career_shadowblade_spinal_cut_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Debilitate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you land a melee hit from Stealth with a Hard Success or better, the target loses their Reaction for the rest of the round.
career_shadowblade_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (excluding Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_shadowblade_strong_arm_form_rules: Type: Passive (Thrown) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Ignore 1 penalty die on thrown weapon attacks at Medium.
career_shadowblade_throw_move_strike_rul: Type: Special immediate (Chain) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Make a thrown attack, then immediately move 1 range band toward that target as a Free Action. If you end your turn Engaged, you may draw a weapon freely.
career_shadowblade_unerring_step_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For the next 2 rounds, you cannot suffer penalty dice to movement, Athletics, or Stealth rolls, and you may Disengage as a Free Action once per round.
career_shadowblade_vanish_step_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Hide) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — After you use Cut and Vanish, immediately attempt Stealth. On success, you enter Stealth despite being in combat, provided you end behind cover or in darkness.
career_sigilbound_aegis_absolute_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Total Intercept) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: An ally within Short is targeted by a Targeted Arcane effect. Effect: Negate the effect entirely and anchor the energy harmlessly; no reflection occurs. This cannot be used against area effects or ongoing zones.
career_sigilbound_arcane_lock_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Ward) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Designate a point within Short (doorway, corridor, or chokepoint) as warded. Until the ward ends, enemies making ranged attacks through it suffer 1 penalty die until the start of your next turn.
career_sigilbound_arcane_reversal_rules-: Type: Free Action (Restore) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — When you successfully resolve a Warding spell that blocks, suppresses, or shields an effect, you may immediately restore up to 1d4 Strain to yourself or one ally within Short, to a maximum equal to the triggering spell’s Strain cost.
career_sigilbound_barrier_projection_rul: Type: Action (Barrier) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Conjure a barrier within Short that provides Partial Cover. Enemies attacking a target using this barrier for Cover suffer 1 penalty die. The barrier lasts for the scene unless destroyed by sufficient damage or dispelled.
career_sigilbound_counterglyph_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: A nearby enemy within Short casts a spell. Effect: That caster suffers 1 penalty die on the spellcasting roll. If the spell fails, the caster also suffers 1d4 Strain.
career_sigilbound_glyph_warder_rules-u: Type: Passive (Maintain) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — You may reposition or reassign one ward you control once per round as a Free Action, provided the ward’s normal placement rules are obeyed. This does not extend duration, reduce Strain cost, or allow more than one warded effect to be sustained at a time. Only one Null Field may be active at a time.
career_sigilbound_glyphstep_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Shift) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are targeted by a spell or attack. Effect: Move 1 range band as a Free Action, ending in a space you could reasonably reach by movement (such as open ground, behind cover, or through an unobstructed path).
career_sigilbound_line_unbroken_rules-u: Type: Action (Anchor Zone) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Create a fortified warded zone within Short for 2 rounds. Allies inside gain +1 bonus die on CON and POW to resist Arcane effects and cannot be forcibly moved. Only one Line Unbroken may be active at a time.
career_sigilbound_mirror_sigil_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Redirect) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You are targeted by a Targeted harmful spell or Targeted ranged attack. Effect: The attacker suffers 1 penalty die. If the attack misses, you may redirect it to another enemy within Short, using the original attack roll. The redirected effect cannot be redirected again.
career_sigilbound_null_field_rules-u: Type: Action (Suppress) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Create a suppression zone within Short. For one round, spells cast inside or through the zone suffer 1 penalty die. This does not suppress existing magical effects or passive enchantments.
career_sigilbound_reflective_ward_rules-: Type: Reaction (Reflect) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are targeted by a Targeted spell. Effect: The caster suffers 1 penalty die on the spellcasting roll. If the spell fails, it is negated and reflects onto the caster as if they were the target, using the spell’s normal effects and resistances.
career_sigilbound_runesight_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on a Magic (Warding) check. The first Warding spell you cast this scene to block, suppress, or counter ignores 1 Strain of its cost. This benefit applies only once per scene and only to that first qualifying spell.
career_sigilbound_runesovereign_rules-u: Type: Special Immediate (Double Cast) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Cast two Warding spells in the same round, provided each has a casting time of 1 Action or 1 Maneuver. Both spells resolve normally and cannot benefit from cost reductions, reflections, or additional reactions this round. After resolving both spells, you cannot cast Warding spells until the start of your next turn.
career_sigilbound_sanctum_sigil_rules-u: Type: Action (Zone) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Create a warded zone centered on you with a Short-radius. Allies inside gain +1 bonus die on CON or POW rolls to resist Arcane effects. Only one Sanctum Sigil may be active at a time.
career_sigilbound_sigil_hardened_rules-u: Type: Passive (Fortitude) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die on CON rolls to resist knockdown, suppression, or forced movement.
career_sigilbound_sigil_of_anchoring_rul: Type: Maneuver (Ward) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Place a glyph on you or an ally within Short; until the start of your next turn, the target cannot be forcibly moved or teleported.
career_sigilbound_sigil_pulse_rules-u: Type: Special immediate (Detonate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When one of your wards ends naturally or is dispelled by an enemy, enemies within Short of that ward take 1d4 Arcane damage and suffer 1 penalty die on their next action. This effect may trigger only once per scene.
career_sigilbound_sigil_reservoir_rules-: Type: Free Action (Prepared Ward) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When you would place an Arcane Lock or Null Field, you may place it as a Free Action instead of its normal Action or Maneuver. This does not allow you to maintain more than one warded effect at a time and does not alter the ward’s duration or usage limits.
career_sigilbound_sigilburst_protocol_ru: Type: Special immediate (Detonate Ward) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Detonate one active ward you control. Enemies in that ward’s area take 2d6 Arcane damage and suffer 1 penalty die on their next action. The ward ends immediately and cannot trigger additional detonations.
career_sigilbound_stabilization_glyph_ru: Type: Maneuver (Ward) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Ward an ally within Short. The next time they would drop below 1 HP this scene, they instead remain at 1 HP. Only one Stabilization Glyph may be active at a time, and a character cannot benefit from more than one per scene.
career_sigilbound_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_sigilbound_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase your maximum Strain by +1. (This talent may appear in multiple Career Trees.)
career_sigilbound_veil_seal_rules-u: Type: Action (Cleanse/Suppress) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Suppress a Veil anomaly or magical corruption within Short. You may also reduce an ally’s Veil Corruption by 1 level.
career_sigilbound_warded_advance_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Shield) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you and an ally both move in the same round and end closer to danger, you conjure a temporary glyph shield. The next time either of you is hit before the start of your next turn, reduce that damage by 2 after Armor.
career_sigilbound_warding_matrix_rules-u: Type: Action (Shield) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Shield up to two allies within Short. They gain +2 Armor against Arcane damage for the rest of the scene. This bonus does not stack with other magical Armor bonuses.
career_sigilbound_wardmasters_command_ru: Type: Action (Empower Allies) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Designate up to three allies within Medium. Until the end of the scene, they gain +2 Armor vs. Arcane damage and ignore Arcane terrain effects. This Armor bonus does not stack with other magical Armor bonuses.
career_slicer_arcnet_sovereign_rules-u: Type: Free Action (System Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Declare at the start of your turn: for the rest of the round, all ICE in the same system suffer –1 success tier on attacks, and your Intrusion rolls deal +1 damage on success.
career_slicer_black_trace_nullifier_rule: Type: Special immediate (Chain Cleanse) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you remove a Trace Lock with a Masking roll, you may remove one additional Trace Lock from yourself for free (same trigger window).
career_slicer_code_pressure_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Boost) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on one Intrusion roll to breach a node or defeat ICE. On Hard+ success, regain 1 Strain.
career_slicer_command_fork_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Fork) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — After you seize control of a node, activate one additional connected subsystem as a Free Action (e.g., open a secured door and loop its camera).
career_slicer_deck_hardening_suite_rules: Type: Passive (Armor) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Your OmniDeck gains +1 Armor Rating (AR). Also 1/Session: when taking digital damage, reduce it by 2 before applying AR.
career_slicer_digital_ghost_state_rules-: Type: Free Action (Ghost) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For 2 rounds, you cannot be detected by standard Trace protocols, and passive ICE treat you as inactive. You may not attack while in Ghost State.
career_slicer_emergency_partition_rules-: Type: Reaction (Persist) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: Your Deck Integrity is reduced to 0. Effect: Stay online for 1 more round; you crash after that unless repaired.
career_slicer_expanded_node_logic_rules-: Type: Special immediate (Fork+) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When using Command Fork, you may extend control to a third subsystem in a connected node (lights, alarms, doors). You may not affect more than one node at once with this extension.
career_slicer_failsafe_override_core_rul: Type: Reaction (Last Action) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: Your Deck would crash or you would be forcibly ejected. Effect: Remain connected at 1 Deck Integrity and take one final action before crashing.
career_slicer_fastjack_ready_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Economy) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Reduce the action cost by one step when activating or swapping a Program (Action → Maneuver or Maneuver → Free Action).
career_slicer_icebreaker_thread_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Boost) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die when attacking or bypassing ICE. If that ICE is disabled/bypassed completely, regain 1 Strain.
career_slicer_iceburn_protocol_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Splash) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you crash a piece of ICE, deal 1d6 damage to another ICE in the same node. If that ICE is destroyed, regain 1 Strain.
career_slicer_kill_switch_routine_rules-: Type: Free Action (Stance) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — For 2 rounds, whenever you crash a node or ICE, choose one: regain 1 Strain or deal 1d3 damage to another connected ICE.
career_slicer_multi_layer_spoof_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Masking) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Gain +1 bonus die to Masking to avoid a Trace or bypass a system under active surveillance/AI monitoring.
career_slicer_null_pulse_routine_rules-u: Type: Action (Surge) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Target a Security or Data node within line of sight; it shuts down for 1 round.
career_slicer_omnideck_recompiler_rules-: Type: Free Action (Swap) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Instantly reload/replace one installed Program.
career_slicer_packet_surge_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Spike) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You gain a Trace Lock. Effect: Until the end of your next turn, gain +1 bonus die on your next Masking or Intrusion roll against that system.
career_slicer_predictive_override_rules-: Type: Passive (Scan Insight) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — When you get a Hard Success scanning a node, you also identify connected ICE behavior type (aggressive / reactive / trace / trap) without triggering it.
career_slicer_pulse_cloak_shell_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Cloak) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — When you enter a new node, activate Pulse Cloak: until your next action, any Trace or ICE activation against you suffers –1 success tier.
career_slicer_rapid_inject_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Activate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Activate any installed Program as a Free Action instead of an Action.
career_slicer_redundancy_stack_rules-u: Type: Passive (Mitigate) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — When your OmniDeck takes digital damage, reduce it by 1 (min 0) automatically. No roll or Reaction required.
career_slicer_reflex_proxy_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Mitigate) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You fail a Firewall Rating defense roll vs digital damage. Effect: Reroll. On success, halve the damage (round down).
career_slicer_signal_collapse_routine_ru: Type: Special immediate (Reset) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — If you crash two or more ICE in a single round, force a Trace Reset: remove all Trace Locks from yourself and make a free Masking roll to mask your presence.
career_slicer_signal_ghost_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Masking) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: You would gain a Trace Lock. Effect: Immediately roll Masking; on success, negate the Trace Lock.
career_slicer_silent_loop_rules-u: Type: Action (Loop) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Designate one node; until scene end, that node does not trigger passive ICE against you.
career_slicer_stat_boost_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase any one core stat (including Magic) by +5%, up to racial maximum. May only be taken once.
career_slicer_system_sniffer_rules-u: Type: Passive (Scan) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die when scanning for hidden nodes, encrypted links, or ghost connections in any ArcNet system.
career_slicer_trace_evasion_protocol_rul: Type: Reaction (Cleanse) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: A Trace Lock is applied to you. Effect: Immediately attempt to remove it with a Masking roll as a Free Action (doesn’t consume your turn’s Action).
career_slicer_trace_spoofer_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Cleanse) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: The system applies a Trace Lock to you. Effect: Cancel it immediately.
career_soul_forger_battlefield_reclamati: Type: Action • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Target a wrecked, powered-down, or abandoned small chassis within Short range (drone, bot, or turret shell). Bind a Bound Spirit into the shell, reanimating it under your command for the Scene. Statline: HP 6; DR 1 (physical); Attack 45% for 1d6 (melee or light mounted weapon if present). The shell counts as spirit-infused. When the Scene ends or the shell reaches 0 HP, it becomes inert scrap. The reclaimed shell acts on your Initiative and may take either one Action or one Maneuver each Round, not both.
career_soul_forger_bound_warchassis_rule: Type: Downtime Creation; Passive in Play • Build Cost: 10,000 credits (base frame) — In Downtime, permanently bind a Bound Spirit into a combat chassis built from a suitable salvaged shell. It acts on your Initiative with one Maneuver and one Action per Round. Baseline Statline: HP 10; DR 2 (physical); Evasion 40%; Attack 55%. Choose one role at binding: Skirmisher (melee 1d6+1), Gunner (weapon supplied separately), or Bulwark (allies Engaged gain +1 cover step; melee 1d6). The chassis is always spirit-infused and ignores EMP/Blackout (it instead becomes Impaired until the start of its next turn). You may apply one Tier 2 or Tier 3 Soul Forger buff to it at a time. If reduced to 0 HP, it becomes inert. Emergency Wake (1/Session): At Engaged range, take an Action, pay 1d6 Strain, and roll Arcanotech or Mechanics; on success it rises to 1 HP (Hard+ restores 1d6+1 HP). Full repair requires Downtime. Only one War-Chassis may be active at a time. Each Round, the War-Chassis may take either one Action or one Maneuver. If you forgo your Maneuver on your turn, the War-Chassis may take both one Action and one Maneuver that Round.
career_soul_forger_cathedral_of_scrap_ru: Type: Action • Cost: 1d8+2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — If sufficient debris exists within Short range, fuse multiple Bound Spirits into a single Large colossus at Engaged range for the Scene. Statline: HP 16; DR 3 (physical); Dodge 35%; Smash 65% (1d8+2); Hurl Debris 55% (1d6, Medium range). Traits: Bulwark Mass (allies Engaged gain Partial Cover; ranged attacks against them suffer 1 penalty die), Impact (on a Hard+ Smash, either knock the target back one range band or impose Impaired until the start of its next turn). The colossus acts with one Maneuver and one Action per Round and collapses into inert scrap when the Scene ends or at 0 HP.
career_soul_forger_chassis_ride_rules-u: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: At-will — Bind a Bound Spirit into a drone or turret within Medium range. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by Defense Rating or operator skill. While riding, choose one benefit for the Scene: +10% to attacks or +10% to evasion/control. When the ride ends, the unit becomes Impaired until the start of its next turn. Cannot target systems housing Greater Spirits. In combat scenes, this effect lasts until the end of your next turn unless extended by spending 1 Strain at the start of your turn (maximum 3 total turns).
career_soul_forger_circuit_apotheosis_ru: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d6+2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You project your spirit into the ArcNet for the Scene; your body falls prone but remains conscious. Choose an access point within Medium range as your entry node. While apotheosed, treat that node as Engaged for ArcNet actions. With an OmniDeck: gain +10% to all Slicing rolls; when targeted in the ArcNet, you may defend using Slicing instead of the deck’s Defense Rating. Without an OmniDeck: you may perform ArcNet support actions only (scan, assist, stabilize, open/close nodes); you cannot make ArcNet attack actions. Any ArcNet feedback damage you suffer is taken as Strain instead of HP. If this drops you to 0 Strain, the effect ends immediately and you are Impaired on your next turn. If your body takes damage, the effect ends immediately. You may end this effect as a Free Action at the start of your turn. Bound Spirits within the ArcNet may be leveraged; Greater Spirits and Avatars remain beyond your control. This talent does not reduce interaction time, escalation, or System Overrun effects.
career_soul_forger_city_weave_circuit_ru: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d6+1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You must be Engaged with an access point (console, junction box, relay) tied to a single site-scale security domain within Medium range. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the site’s Defense Rating. On success, you seize control of the domain for the Scene: site sensors ignore your crew; hostile remote actions suffer 1 penalty die; doors, gates, and elevators respond to your commands; site turrets and drones treat your crew as friendly. Protocol Pulse (Free, 1/Round): Choose one — Lock Cycle (force open or closed one door/gate), Blind Eye (one sensor cluster ignores all targets or only sees hostiles for 1 Round), or Sentry Jinx (one site turret/drone takes –20% until the start of your next turn). You must remain within the site; starting a new Concentration ends this effect. Bound Spirits within the site obey the weave; Greater Spirits are unaffected. Hardened subsystems ignore individual Protocol Pulse effects. Each Protocol Pulse costs 1 Strain.
career_soul_forger_counteremp_veil_rules: Type: Reaction (Interrupt) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare before a disabling effect roll resolves. When a machine or spirit-frame within Medium range would be disabled by EMP or Blackout, it ignores the shutdown and instead becomes Impaired until the end of its next turn.
career_soul_forger_hand_of_the_forge_rul: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When a spirit-infused ally within Short range takes damage, reduce that damage by 1d6. This reduction applies only to the triggering hit.
career_soul_forger_helmgeist_protocol_ru: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — You must be in physical contact with or inside a vehicle or facility subsystem. Bind a Bound Spirit into the host system for the Scene. Choose one duty on activation: Assist — the living operator’s Piloting, Driving, or Gunnery rolls gain +10% each Round; or Autopilot/Gunnery — if the operator is absent, incapacitated, or cedes control, the spirit takes one vehicle action per Round at 40% (Piloting/Driving 40% or mounted Gunnery 40%). Changing duty costs a Maneuver. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the system’s Defense Rating or an opposing operator’s skill if contested. This talent cannot target systems already housing a Greater Spirit or Avatar.
career_soul_forger_infused_shielding_rul: Type: Reaction (Guard) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare when a spirit-infused ally within Short range is hit by an attack. Reduce the triggering damage by 1d6 + 1 (before DR). This reduction applies only to that single hit and does not persist beyond the triggering attack.
career_soul_forger_lockout_sigil_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: At-will — Ward a machine or automated system within Short range. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the system’s Defense Rating or an opposing operator’s skill if contested. On a success, until the end of the target’s next turn, the device loses Reactions. This talent does not reduce attack values, impose penalties, or affect manually operated actions.
career_soul_forger_nullwave_bloom_rules-: Type: Action • Cost: 1d8+2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Release a Veil-charged disruption pulse out to Medium range. Unattended devices, drones, and vehicles animated by Bound Spirits are Stunned until the start of your next turn (they lose their Action and Maneuver, but may still take Reactions if applicable), then become Impaired for 1 Round. Attended machines oppose your Technomancy or Summoning with the higher of the operator’s relevant skill or the device’s Defense Rating; on your success, the host machine is Stunned until the start of your next turn, then Impaired for 1 Round; on a success by the defender, it becomes Impaired for 1 Round only. Individuals in range test POW; on a failure, their comms, Smartlink, optics, and HUDs are disabled until the start of their next turn (no Condition applied). Cyberware, life-support systems, and non-smart firearms are unaffected. Greater Spirits and Avatars are unaffected.
career_soul_forger_overclock_lattice_rul: Type: Maneuver • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Target a spirit-infused machine within Short range. Until the end of the Scene, grant either +10% to its attacks or +10% to its dodge/defense (choose once when activated). If the machine fumbles a roll while overclocked, it becomes Impaired until the start of your next turn.
career_soul_forger_seat_the_spirit_rules: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: At-will — Invite a Lesser Spirit to ride an unattended simple system within Short range (door, camera, unattended turret, civilian drone, parked vehicle subsystem). Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the system’s Defense Rating or an opposing operator’s skill if contested. On a success, you direct the system for the Scene using basic functions only. Cannot target systems already housing a Bound or Greater Spirit. Starting a new Concentration effect immediately ends this ride.
career_soul_forger_soulstitch_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene per target — At Engaged or Short range, repair 2d6 HP to a machine or spirit-frame. If the target is at 0 HP, it rises to 1 HP and clears Incapacitated. A given target may benefit from Soulstitch only once per Scene.
career_soul_forger_spirit_lattice_field_: Type: Action; Concentration • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Project a Short-radius aura centered on you for the Scene. Once per Round, when a spirit-infused ally within the aura is attacked, you may impose 1 penalty die on that attack. This effect applies once per Round per affected unit, regardless of spirit tier.
career_soul_forger_spirit_patch_rules-u: Type: Action • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: At-will — At Engaged or Short range, repair 1d6 HP to a machine, drone, turret, or spirit-frame and clear one of the following conditions from the target: Jammed or Overheated. If the target is currently spirit-infused by you, restore +1 additional HP. This talent cannot target living tissue.
career_soul_forger_spirit_static_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Interrupt) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Declare when a machine, drone, or automated system within Short range targets you or an ally with an attack. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the system’s Defense Rating or an opposing operator’s skill if contested. On a success, impose 1 penalty die on the triggering attack. On a Hard Success, the target is Impaired until the start of your next turn.
career_soul_forger_spitework_rewrite_rul: Type: Action • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Target a hostile drone or turret within Short range. Roll Technomancy or Summoning opposed by the unit’s Defense Rating or an opposing operator’s skill if contested. On a success, the effect lasts until the end of the target’s next turn. On a Hard Success, the target also loses its Reaction on its next turn.
career_soul_forger_workshop_wisp_rules-u: Type: Active (Downtime Creation; Utility Companion) • Cost: 500 credits (ground) or 1,000 credits (flying) + 5 XP • Usage: Persistent (one active at a time) — Create a Tiny non-combat Lesser Spirit bound into a simple machine shell (1 HP). Acts on your Initiative. Once per Scene, the Wisp may Assist one Arcanotech, Mechanics, or Electronics test for +1 bonus die. EMP or Blackout do not disable it; instead, it becomes Impaired until the start of your next turn.
career_spirit_warden_avatars_mandate_rul: Type: Action (Petition) • Cost: 1d4 + 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Petition the local Avatar Spirit. If it answers, it enacts one significant intervention this Scene (environmental suppression, spiritual protection, enforced boundaries, or authoritative command). The nature and tone of the response reflect your standing and prior conduct in the domain.
career_spirit_warden_basic_ritual_circle: Type: Maneuver (Ritual) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After one full Round of uninterrupted work, create a simple ritual circle. If you are forced to move, incapacitated, or take damage during this time, the ritual is disrupted. While you remain inside the circle, gain +1 bonus die on banish or command actions against Lesser or Bound Spirits. The circle lasts for the Scene or until disrupted by movement or interference.
career_spirit_warden_bound_spirit_partne: Type: Action (Summon) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Summon your personal Bound Spirit within Short. This summon does not require Concentration and is a unique exception to normal sustain rules. The spirit acts on your initiative and remains for the Scene. If dispersed, it cannot be resummoned this Scene. You may not have more than one Bound Spirit Partner active at a time, and this talent does not allow additional sustained effects or establish a precedent for other summons.
career_spirit_warden_circle_flow_discipl: Type: Free Action (Escort) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — When you and one ally both move in the same round and end closer to a spiritual threat, reduce the damage or effect of the next spirit-origin attack against either of you this round by 1d6.
career_spirit_warden_circle_marked_recal: Type: Reaction (Recall) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: A spirit you summoned is disrupted or forced to withdraw. Effect: If it is within Medium and you have line of effect, recall it to Engaged range. This movement does not provoke reactions and cannot place the spirit into an occupied or hazardous space.
career_spirit_warden_confront_the_echo_r: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — When you successfully banish a spirit, it suffers 1d4 Resonant backlash. This does not apply to Avatar Spirits.
career_spirit_warden_custodians_stand_ru: Type: Reaction (Anchor) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are targeted by forced movement, possession, or a spirit-origin control effect. Effect: Ignore the forced movement or negate the control effect, and you cannot be displaced until the start of your next turn.
career_spirit_warden_domain_resonance_ci: Type: Maneuver (Ritual) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — After two uninterrupted Rounds of work, create a domain-attuned circle (such as street, building, transit hub, industrial zone). While you remain inside it, gain +1 bonus die on command or banish actions against spirits tied to that domain and +1 bonus die on cleanse attempts affecting corruption within the domain.
career_spirit_warden_eidolon_apotheosis_: Type: Action (Ascension) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Elevate your Bound Spirit Partner into its ascended form for the Scene. It gains +4 Integrity, +1 damage die step, DR 1, acts independently, and automatically reforms once if dispersed. It also gains one unique thematic ability chosen when you learn this talent.
career_spirit_warden_grand_exorcism_rite: Type: Action (Final Banishment) • Cost: 2d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Perform a full exorcism against a spirit within Short. Lesser Spirits are destroyed, Bound Spirits cannot return for 24 hours, and Greater Spirits are expelled from the area for 24 hours. If no Greater Spirit is present, choose one additional effect affecting the immediate scene space (GM discretion): suppress all possession attempts for the Scene, reduce a corruption pocket by one tier, or impose 1 penalty die on all hostile spirit-origin actions until scene end. This action does not provoke Reactions. Failure still costs Strain but causes no backlash.
career_spirit_warden_lesser_companion_bo: Type: Action • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Summon a personalized Lesser Companion Spirit. Choose one skill (Arcana, Spirit Lore, or Insight); gain +1 bonus die on one roll using that skill this Scene. The companion disperses if harmed or when the Scene ends.
career_spirit_warden_lesser_spirit_conju: Type: Action (Summon) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: At-will — Summon a Lesser Spirit you know. It acts on your initiative and lasts for the Scene unless destroyed. If you summon another Lesser Spirit while one is active, the previous spirit disperses immediately.
career_spirit_warden_line_held_against_t: Type: Reaction (Absolute Stand) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Trigger: A spirit-origin effect would cause any of the following: more than one possession in a round, the creation of a new Greater Spirit, escalation of a corruption pocket by two or more steps, or the loss of control of a spiritual site. Effect: Until the start of your next turn, no new possession attempts can occur, no spirits may enter or leave the area, corruption cannot increase, and all active spirit-origin effects suffer 1 penalty die. This does not end effects, only halts escalation.
career_spirit_warden_purifications_edge_: Type: Action (Focus) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Target a corrupted spirit or corruption pocket. Your next cleanse, banish, or purify attempt this Scene gains +1 bonus die. On a success, reduce the corruption level by one step.
career_spirit_warden_rite_efficiency_rul: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Reduce the Strain cost of one summoning or banishment you perform this Scene by 1.
career_spirit_warden_rite_of_echo_severa: Type: Action (Sever) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Sever a spirit’s tether to a host, object, or location. Gain +1 bonus die on the banish roll. On a success, the spirit cannot reattach for the Scene. Against corrupted targets, reduce corruption by one tier.
career_spirit_warden_sanctify_the_ground: Type: Action (Site Consecration) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Cleanse and stabilize a location within Short for the remainder of the Scene. All corruption pockets are suppressed, possession attempts automatically fail, and spirits hostile to the site’s nature suffer 1 penalty die on all actions. This effect lingers narratively after the scene ends.
career_spirit_warden_silencing_hand_rule: Type: Action (Disrupt) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Your next banish attempt against a Greater Spirit this Scene causes its resistance to lose one bonus die or suffer one penalty die (GM chooses). This does not apply to Avatar Spirits.
career_spirit_warden_sovereign_pattern_r: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Reduce the Strain cost of banish attempts against Greater Spirits by one die size. Once per Session, reduce the Strain cost of a Greater Spirit petition by 1.
career_spirit_warden_spirit_economy_rule: Type: Free Action (Conversion) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Convert only the Strain rolled from this ability into a reduction on the next Summoning Strain cost you would pay this Scene, to a maximum reduction equal to the Strain rolled. If used while inside a circle you created, reduce the resulting Summoning Strain by an additional 1.
career_spirit_warden_spirit_sense_attune: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — Gain +1 bonus die to detect, identify, or interpret spiritual residue, echoes, or minor disturbances. When you Push a Perception or Arcana roll against spiritual phenomena, gain +1 bonus die on the pushed roll.
career_spirit_warden_wardbreaker_gesture: Type: Action (Setup) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Before making a banish attempt against a Lesser or Bound Spirit, perform the gesture. Your next banish this Scene gains +1 bonus die.
career_spirit_warden_wardens_barrier_sig: Type: Reaction (Interdict) • Cost: 1d4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An ally within Short is targeted by a possession or spirit-origin attack. Effect: Negate one possession attempt, or reduce the damage or effect by 1d6. Lesser Spirits are repelled automatically. This reduction does not stack with other Spirit Warden reductions.
career_spirit_warden_wardens_binding_cir: Type: Maneuver (Ritual) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — After one full Round of uninterrupted work, create a reinforced ritual circle. While you remain inside it, gain +1 bonus die on banish actions against Bound Spirits, and Greater Spirits inside suffer 1 penalty die on actions directly opposing you. Once this Scene, while inside this circle, reduce the Strain cost of one Summoning action you perform by 1.
career_spirit_warden_wardens_wards_rules: Type: Reaction (Interdict) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You or an ally within Short is targeted by a possession or spirit-origin effect. Effect: Reduce the effect by 1d6, or negate a single possession attempt from a Lesser Spirit. This reduction does not stack with other reductions from Spirit Warden talents.
career_stormweaver_arc_feedback_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You are hit by a melee attack. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the attacker’s CON. On a success, the attacker suffers 1 penalty die on their next action and cannot make Reactions until the end of the round.
career_stormweaver_arc_flare_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Dazzle) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: After you successfully resolve an Elemental spell against a target in Engaged. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on their next action taken before the end of their following turn.
career_stormweaver_burn_current_rules-u: Type: Action (Elemental Shock) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — You release a violent surge of elemental force that you can no longer fully contain. Each enemy currently in Engaged range must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with a CON roll. Any target you defeat takes 1d6 Arcane damage and suffers 1 penalty die on their next action before the end of their following turn. Targets that succeed suffer no damage and no penalty. This effect represents uncontrolled elemental discharge rather than a spell and cannot benefit from spell modifiers, bonus dice, cost reductions, or talents that modify spellcasting.
career_stormweaver_burnline_pressure_rul: Type: Reaction (Zone Pressure) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: An enemy enters or leaves Engaged with you. Effect: Roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on its next action.
career_stormweaver_dig_in_the_storm_rule: Type: Reaction (Stance) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: You would be subjected to forced movement, a shove, or a knockdown effect. Effect: You immediately enter a braced stance. Negate that instance of forced movement, and gain +1 bonus die on CON rolls to resist knockdown or shove effects until the end of your next turn. While this stance is active, you cannot benefit from talents that grant additional movement or teleportation.
career_stormweaver_eye_of_the_storm_rule: Type: Free Action (Veil Trance) • Cost: 1d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Activate at the start of your turn. Until the end of your next turn, you ignore one penalty die imposed on your Elemental spellcasting rolls each round. Once during this duration, you may reroll one failed Elemental spellcasting roll. While this effect is active, you cannot benefit from talents that grant additional movement or teleportation. This talent is not a spell and is not affected by effects that modify or penalize spells unless explicitly stated.
career_stormweaver_flashfire_assault_rul: Type: Special Immediate (Follow-Up) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Immediately after you successfully cast an Elemental spell, make one Melee or Thrown attack against a target in Engaged or Short as an incidental. This attack does not consume your Action, does not grant additional Reactions, and cannot benefit from bonus dice from talents. If this attack misses, you suffer 1 Strain.
career_stormweaver_flashstep_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Mobility) • Cost: 2 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Immediately take one Move Maneuver. This movement ignores difficult terrain and does not provoke Reactions. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_hold_the_current_rule: Type: Free Action (Cast Mod) • Cost: 1 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Gain +1 bonus die on a Magic (Elemental) roll as you forcibly stabilize volatile energy. If the spell succeeds, resolve its Strain cost normally. If the spell fails, increase the spell's Strain die by one step before rolling Strain.
career_stormweaver_killzone_instinct_rul: Type: Passive (Threat Sense) • Cost: — • Usage: At-will — While you are at Engaged or Short range, you gain +10% to Dodge rolls against any enemy that has been successfully affected by one of your Elemental spells earlier this scene. An enemy is considered affected if they failed a resistance roll or otherwise suffered the spell’s primary effect. This benefit does not apply against enemies unaffected by the spell’s resolution.
career_stormweaver_scorchmark_rules-u: Type: Maneuver (Brand) • Cost: 3 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Brand a living enemy within Short with arcane fire. Your next Elemental spell targeting that enemy gains +1 bonus die. The brand ends when that spell resolves, the target dies, or the scene ends. This bonus die does not stack with other talent-granted bonus dice.
career_stormweaver_shockstep_conduit_rul: Type: Action (Teleport) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Teleport to a visible point within Medium. Enemies in Engaged range at your starting and ending positions must each oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with a CON roll. Any target you defeat takes 1d4 Arcane damage. Targets that succeed suffer no damage. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_singularity_discharge: Type: Action (Terminal Overload) • Cost: 1d10 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose one hostile creature within Short and roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target’s CON. On a success, the target takes 4d6 Arcane damage. On a failure, the target takes 2d6 Arcane damage. Regardless of the outcome, you cannot cast Elemental spells again this scene.
career_stormweaver_stormbreak_rules-u: Type: Action (Structural Rupture) • Cost: 1d8 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — Choose a visible terrain feature or structural element within Medium (such as a wall, floor, ceiling, pillar, barricade, or natural formation). You violently rupture it, creating a gaping breach or explosive collapse point. Each hostile creature within Short of that feature must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with CON. On a failure, each affected creature takes 2d6 Physical damage and is either knocked Prone or forcibly displaced one range band (your choice) as the structure collapses. This effect does not destroy armored vehicles or hardened military assets and represents catastrophic environmental destruction rather than a spell.
career_stormweaver_stormcallers_edge_rul: Type: Free Action (Overchannel) • Cost: 4 Strain • Usage: 1/Scene — Before you cast an Elemental spell, declare overchanneling. That spell gains +1 bonus die. If the spell succeeds, you may affect one additional valid target within Short of the original target. This talent may not be used on spells that already affect multiple targets. The bonus die from this talent does not stack with other talent-granted bonus dice. This talent cannot be combined with Surge Engine, Veilcore Meltdown, or any effect that sets a spell’s Strain cost to 0.
career_stormweaver_stormpulse_drive_rule: Type: Free Action (Post-Cast) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Immediately after casting an Elemental spell, take one Move Maneuver. This movement follows normal rules, may provoke Reactions, and does not allow you to exceed the normal limit of two Maneuvers per turn. You may not gain more than one additional movement effect from Stormweaver talents in the same round.
career_stormweaver_strain_buffer_rules-u: Type: Passive • Cost: — • Usage: Permanent — Increase maximum Strain by +1. (This talent appears in multiple Career Trees.)
career_stormweaver_surge_engine_rules-u: Type: Free Action (Cost Waiver) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Cast your next Elemental spell this turn for 0 Strain. Eligibility: the spell’s base Strain die must be 1d6 or smaller before any modifiers. Anti-stacking: this spell cannot benefit from any other cost-reduction or bonus-die talents.
career_stormweaver_tinder_spark_rules-u: Type: Action (Utility/Fire) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Session — Ignite a flammable object or surface within Short as residual elemental bleed-off escapes containment. If used against a creature in Engaged, roll Magic (Elemental) opposed by the target's CON. On a success, the target suffers 1 penalty die on their next physical action due to heat and distraction.
career_stormweaver_total_elemental_colla: Type: Action (Overload Release) • Cost: 2d6 Strain • Usage: 1/Session — You release all remaining elemental pressure in a violent, uncontrolled surge. Each hostile creature within Medium must oppose your Magic (Elemental) roll with CON. Any target you defeat takes 3d6 Arcane damage. Targets that succeed take no damage. After resolving this action, you cannot cast Elemental spells or activate talents that modify spells for the remainder of the scene. This effect represents catastrophic elemental failure rather than a spell and cannot benefit from spell modifiers, bonus dice, or cost reductions.
career_stormweaver_veil_backlash_rules-u: Type: Reaction (Disrupt) • Cost: — • Usage: 1/Scene — Trigger: After you take damage from a melee attack.
